data/full_data/test/aime_1983_p2.json:
fun abs :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" where
  "abs x = (if x >= 0 then x else -x)"

lemma abs_real_pos:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "abs x = x"
proof -
  have "0 \<le> x" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis using assms by auto
qed

lemma absolute_value_simplification:
  fixes x p :: real
  assumes "0 < p" "p < 15" "p \<le> x" "x \<le> 15"
  shows "abs (x - p) = x - p"
proof -
  have "x - p \<ge> 0" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis using assms by (auto simp: abs_real_pos)
qed

fun f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" where
  "f x = 30 - x"

lemma f_x_min_value_attained:
  fixes p :: real
  assumes h0: "0 < p \<and> p < 15"
  shows "f 15 = 15"
proof -
  have "f 15 = 30 - 15" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma absolute_value_nonneg:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "0 \<le> abs x"
proof (cases "x \<ge> 0")
  case True
  then show ?thesis by simp
next
  case False
  then have "x < 0" by simp
  hence "-x > 0" by simp
  hence "abs x = -x" by auto
  thus "0 \<le> abs x" by simp
qed

lemma absolute_value_simplification1:
  fixes x p :: real
  assumes "0 < p" "p < 15" "p \<le> x" "x \<le> 15"
  shows "abs (x - p) = x - p"
  using assms by (auto simp add: absolute_value_nonneg)

lemma absolute_value_simplification3:
  fixes x p :: real
  assumes "0 < p" "p < 15" "x < p"
  shows "abs (x - 15) = 15 - x"
proof -
  have "15 - x > 0" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis using assms by auto
qed

lemma inequality_rearrangement:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "(x * sqrt 2 - 1)^2 \<ge> 0"
proof -
  have "0 \<le> x * sqrt 2" using assms by auto
  hence "0 \<le> (x * sqrt 2 - 1)^2" by auto
  thus ?thesis by simp

lemma algebraic_manipulation_4:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "a * c + b * d = e" and "a * c + b * d = f" and "e = f" and "f = g"
  shows "a * c + b * d = g"
proof -
  have "a * c + b * d = e" by fact
  then have "a * c + b * d = f" by (metis assms(2))
  then have "a * c + b * d = g" by (metis assms(4))
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma solve_for_ax5_by5:
  fixes a b x y :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y = 3"
    and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7"
    and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16"
    and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42" 
  shows "a * x^5 + b * y^5 = 20"
proof -
  have "a * x + b * y = 3" and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7" and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16" and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42" using assms by auto
  then have "a * x^5 + b * y^5 = 20" by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma relationship:
  fixes a b x y :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y = 3"
    and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7"
    and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16"
    and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42"
  shows "(a * x^5 + b * y^5) + (x * y) * (a * x^3 + b * y^3) = (a * x^4 + b * y^4) * (x + y)"
proof -
  have "(a * x^5 + b * y^5) + (x * y) * (a * x^3 + b * y^3) = (a * x^4 + b * y^4) * (x + y)"
    using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b x y :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y = 3"
    and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7"
    and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16"
    and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42"
  shows "(a * x^4 + b * y^4) * (x + y) = (a * x^5 + b * y^5) + (x * y) * (a * x^3 + b * y^3)"
  by sos

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b x y :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y = 3"
    and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7"
    and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16"
    and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42" 
  shows "(a * x^4 + b * y^4) * (x + y) = (a * x^5 + b * y^5) + (x * y) * (a * x^3 + b * y^3)"
proof -
  have "a * x^4 * x + a * x^4 * y + b * y^4 * x + b * y^4 * y = a * x^5 + b * y^5 + x * y * (a * x^3 + b * y^3)"
    by sos
  then have "(a * x^4 + b * y^4) * x + (a * x^4 + b * y^4) * y = a * x^5 + b * y^5 + x * y * (a * x^3 + b * y^3)"
    by sos
  then have "(a * x^4 + b * y^4) * (x + y) = a * x^5 + b * y^5 + x * y * (a * x^3 + b * y^3)"
    by sos
  then show ?thesis using assms by auto
qed

lemma second_equation:
  fixes a b x y :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y = 3"
    and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7"
    and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16"
    and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42" 
  shows "16 * (x + y) = 42 + 7 * (x * y)"
proof -
  have "(a * x^4 + b * y^4) * (x + y) = (a * x^5 + b * y^5) + (x * y) * (a * x^3 + b * y^3)" using algebraic_manipulation assms by auto
  then have "16 * (x + y) = 42 + 7 * (x * y)" using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed
data/full_data/test/algebra_2varlineareq:
lemma cancel_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x" using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "x * a + b = c * x" using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes f z :: complex
  assumes 
    "f + 3*z = 11" and "z = 7"
  shows "f + 21 = 11"
proof -
  have "f + 3*z = 11"
    using assms(1) by simp
  also have "3*z = 3*7"
    using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = 21"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally have "f + 21 = 11"
    by simp
  thus ?thesis .
qed

lemma linear_equation_manipulation:
  fixes f z :: complex
  assumes 
    "f + 3*z = 11"
  shows "-3*(f + 3*z) = -33"
proof -
  have "-3*(f + 3*z) = -3*11"
    using assms by simp
  also have "... = -33"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

lemma aime_1983_p9_lemma:
  fixes y :: real
  shows "9 * y^2 + 4 >= 12 * y"
proof -
  have "9 * y^2 - 12 * y + 4 >= 0"
    by (sos)
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

lemma find_a_b_integer_solution:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes 
    "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9 \<and> b \<le> 9"
    "10 * a + b = 2 * (a + b)"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 8"
proof -
  have "10 * a + b = 2 * a + 2 * b"
    using assms by simp
  then have "8 * a = b"
    by simp
  then have "a = 1"
    using assms(1) by auto
  then have "b = 8"
    using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by (metis assms(1) \<open>a = 1\<close>)
qed
data/full_data/test/algebra_apbpceq2_abp:
theorem algebra_apbpceq2_abpbcpcaeq1_aleq1on3anbleq1ancleq4on3:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<le> b \<and> b \<le> c"
    and "a + b + c = 2"
    and "a * b + b * c + c * a = 1" 
  shows "0 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 1 / 3 \<and> 1 / 3 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 1 \<and> 1 \<le> c \<and> c \<le> 4 / 3"
proof -
  have "0 \<le> a" using assms by sos
  have "a \<le> 1 / 3" using assms by sos
  have "1 / 3 \<le> b" using assms by sos
  have "b \<le> 1" using assms by sos
  have "1 \<le> c" using assms by sos
  have "c \<le> 4 / 3" using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>0 \<le> a\<close> \<open>1 / 3 \<le> b\<close> \<open>1 \<le> c\<close> \<open>a \<le> 1 / 3\<close> \<open>b \<le> 1\<close>)
qed

lemma algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b" "0 < c"
  shows "((a + b + c) / 3)^1 \<le> (a^1 + b^1 + c^1) / 3"
proof -
  have "(a + b + c) / 3 = a / 3 + b / 3 + c / 3" by auto
  also have "...^1 = a/3^1 + b/3^1 + c/3^1" by (simp add: power_divide)
  also have "... = (a^1) / 3 + (b^1) / 3 + (c^1) / 3" by (simp add: power_divide)
  also have "... = (a^1 + b^1 + c^1) / 3" by (simp add: add_divide_distrib)
  finally have "((a + b + c) / 3)^1 = (a^1 + b^1 + c^1) / 3".
  with assms show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma assumption:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 \<le> a * b + b * c + c * a"
  shows "a * b + b * c + c * a > 0"
proof -
  have "0 < a * b + b * c + c * a"
    using assms by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem algebra_binomnegdiscrineq_10alt28asqp1:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "10 * a \<le> 28 * a^2 + 1"
proof -
  have c0: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + 1"
  proof -
    have c1: "(a - (5/28))^2 = a^2 - 10/28*a + (5/28)^2"
      by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
    then have c2: "0 \<le> a^2 - 10/28*a + (5/28)^2" using c1
      by sos
    then have c3: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + 28*((5/28)^2)" using c2
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)
    then have c4: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + 28*((5/28)*(5/28))" using c3
      by sos
    then have c5: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + (25/28)" using c4
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)
    then show ?thesis using c5
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  qed
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

theorem algebra_binomnegdiscrineq_10alt28asqp1_multi:
  fixes a b c :: real
  shows "10 * a + 10 * b + 10 * c \<le> 28 * (a^2 + b^2 + c^2) + 3"
proof -
  have c0: "0 \<le> 28*(a^2 + b^2 + c^2) - 10*a - 10*b - 10*c + 3"
  proof -
    have c1: "(a - (5/28))^2 = a^2 - 10/28*a + (5/28)^2"
      by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
    then have c2: "0 \<le> a^2 - 10/28*a + (5/28)^2" using c1
      by sos
    then have c3: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + 28*((5/28)^2)" using c2
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)
    then have c4: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + 28*((5/28)*(5/28))" using c3
      by sos
    then have c5: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + (25/28)" using c4
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)
    then have c6: "0 \<le> 28*(a^2 + b^2 + c^2) - 10*a - 10*b - 10*c + 28*(5/28)^2 + 28*(5/28)^2 + 28*(5/28)^2" using c5
      by sos
    then have c7: "0 \<le> 28*(a^2 + b^2 + c^2) - 10*a - 10*b - 10*c + 28*((5/28)*(5/28)) + 28*((5/28)*(5/28)) + 28*((5/28)*(5/28))" using c6
      by sos
    then have c8: "0 \<le> 28*(a^2 + b^2 + c^2) - 10*a - 10*b - 10*c + (25/28) + (25/28) + (25/28)" using c7
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)
    then have c9: "0 \<le> 28*(a^2 + b^2 + c^2) - 10*a - 10*b - 10*c + (75/28)" using c8
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)
    then show ?thesis using c9
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  qed
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

lemma expand_square:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "(a - b + 1)^2 = (a - b)^2 + 2 * (a - b) + 1"
proof -
  have "(a - b + 1)^2 = (a - b)^2 + 2 * (a - b) + 1"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma divide_by_2:

  shows "a = -4"
proof -

  also have "... = -4" by auto

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a + b = 0"
  shows "b = -a"
proof -
  have "b = -a + a + b" using assms by simp
  also have "-a + a = 0" by simp

lemma inequality_simplification:
  fixes m :: nat
  assumes "m > 0"
  shows "m * 1 \<le> m + 1"
proof -
  have "m * 1 = m" by simp
  also have "... \<le> m + 1" using assms by (simp add: add.commute)
  finally show ?thesis by (simp add: assms)
qed

lemma amc12b_2020_p6_helper:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "9 \<le> n" 
  shows "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1)"
proof -
  have c1: "(n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1) = ((n + 2) - 1) * (n + 1)"
    by (auto simp: algebra_simps)
  have c2: "((n + 2) - 1) * (n + 1) = (n + 1)^2"
    by (metis add.commute add_diff_cancel_left' group_cancel.add2 nat_1_add_1 power2_eq_square)
  have "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1)"
    using c2 h0 by (metis add.commute c1 of_nat_mult power2_eq_square)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma fact_diff_n_plus_2_n_plus_1:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = (n + 1)^2"
proof -
  have "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = ((n + 2) * (n + 1) * fact n - (n + 1) * fact n) / fact n"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "((n + 2) * (n + 1) * fact n - (n + 1) * fact n) / fact n = ((n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1)) / 1"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "((n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1)) / 1 = (n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1)"
    by (auto simp: algebra_simps)
  also have "(n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1) = ((n + 2) - 1) * (n + 1)"
    by (auto simp: algebra_simps)
  also have "((n + 2) - 1) * (n + 1) = (n + 1)^2"
    by (metis add.commute add_diff_cancel_left' group_cancel.add2 nat_1_add_1 power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12b_2020_p6:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "9 \<le> n" 
  shows "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n"
proof -
  have "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = (n + 1)^2" using fact_diff_n_plus_2_n_plus_1 by simp
  then have "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n" using of_nat_power by (smt (verit))
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma amc12a_2002_p6:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "\<exists>m > n. \<exists>p. m * p \<le> m + p"
proof -
  have "\<exists>m. n < m" by auto
  then obtain m where "n < m" by blast
  have "Suc m * 1 \<le> Suc m + 1" by auto
  then show ?thesis using `n < m` by (metis gt_ex le0 mult_0_right)
qed

lemma am_gm:

  also have "(x + y)^2 >= 0" using assms by simp
  finally have "x^2 + y^2 >= 2*x*y" by sos

lemma solve_equation_simplification:
  fixes a b c x::real
  assumes "x \<noteq> -a"
  assumes "(a - b) / (x + a) = c"
  shows "a - b = c * (x + a)"
proof -
  have "(a - b) / (x + a) = c" using assms by simp
  then have "a - b = c * (x + a)" by (metis add.commute add_eq_0_iff assms(1) frac_eq_eq nonzero_divide_eq_eq)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b c :: real
  shows "a * (b + c) = a * b + a * c"
  by (simp add: algebra_simps)

lemma sum_of_three_equations:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a * (b + c) = 152" "b * (c + a) = 162" "c * (a + b) = 170"
  shows "2 * (a * b + b * c + c * a) = 484"
proof -
  have "2 * (a * b + b * c + c * a) = a * (b + c) + b * (c + a) + c * (a + b)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 152 + 162 + 170" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 484" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma real_number_properties:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a * (b + c) = b * (c + a)"
  shows "a * b + a * c = b * c + a * b"
proof -
  have "a * (b + c) = a * b + a * c" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = b * c + a * b" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show "a * b + a * c = b * c + a * b" by sos
qed

lemma real_number_properties:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a * (b + c) = b * (c + a)"
  shows "a * b + a * c = b * c + a * b"
proof -
  from assms have "a * (b + c) = b * (c + a)" by simp
  then have "a * b + a * c = b * c + b * a" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a * b + a * c = b * c + a * b" by (simp add: ac_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma multi_distrib_complex:
  fixes a b c d :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d"

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"

lemma algebraic_multiplication:
  fixes a b c :: real
  shows "(a + b) * c = a * c + b * c"
proof -
  have "(a + b) * c = c * (a + b)" by (simp add: ac_simps)
  also have "... = c * a + c * b" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  also have "... = a * c + b * c" by (simp add: ac_simps)

  "fact 0 = 1" |
  "fact n = n * fact (n - 1)"

lemma fact_function:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "n > 0 \<Longrightarrow> fact n = (n * fact (n - 1))"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then show ?case
    by (simp add: fact.simps(2) Suc.IH)
qed

lemma fact_extension:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "fact (Suc n) = Suc n * fact n"
proof -
  have "fact (Suc n) = Suc n * fact (Suc n - 1)" by (simp add: fact.simps)
  also have "Suc n - 1 = n" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma fact_extension_2:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * fact (n + 1)"
proof -
  have "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * fact ((n + 2) - 1)" by (simp add: fact.simps)
  also have "(n + 2) - 1 = n + 1" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by (simp add: fact_function)
qed

lemma x_lt_0:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "-1 < x" and "x < 0"
  shows "(1 + n*x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have "(1 + x)^(Suc n) = (1 + x)^n * (1 + x)" by simp
  also have "... > 0" using Suc.prems by (metis assms(1) mult.commute power_Suc real_0_less_add_iff zero_less_power)
  then have "(1 + n*x) + x * (1 + x)^n \<le> (1 + x)^n + x * (1 + x)^n" by (smt (verit) Suc)
  also have "... = (1 + x)^n + x * (1 + x)^n" by simp
  also have "... = (1 + x)^n * (1 + x)" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = (1 + x)^(Suc n)" by simp
  finally show ?case by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality assms(1) less_eq_real_def)
qed

lemma square_mod3_cases:
  fixes a :: int
  shows "a mod 3 = 0 \<or> a mod 3 = 1 \<or> a mod 3 = 2"
proof -

  have c1: "b \<ge> 0 \<and> b \<le> 2"
    by (smt (verit) Euclidean_Division.pos_mod_bound c0 mod_int_pos_iff uminus_int_code(1) zle_add1_eq_le)
  have "b = 0 \<or> b = 1 \<or> b = 2" using c1 by auto
  then have "a mod 3 = 0 \<or> a mod 3 = 1 \<or> a mod 3 = 2" using c0 by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

  then have "x = 36 / 6" by (simp add: divide_eq_eq)
  then have "x = 6" by (simp add: divide_pos_pos)
  then show ?thesis by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_125:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "5 * x = y"
    and  "(x - 3) + (y - 3) = 30" 
  shows "x = 6"
proof -
  have "5 * x = y" and "(x - 3) + (y - 3) = 30" using assms by auto
  then have "5 * x + x - 6 = 30" by auto
  then have "6 * x = 36" by auto
  then have "x = 6" by (simp add: divide_pos_pos)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_125:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "5 * x = y"
    and  "(x - 3) + (y - 3) = 30" 
  shows "x = 6"
proof -
  have "5 * x = y" and "(x - 3) + (y - 3) = 30" using assms by auto
  then have "5 * x = y" and "x + y - 6 = 30" using assms by auto
  then have "x + y = 36" by linarith
  then have "5 * x + x = 36" using `5 * x = y` by auto
  then have "6 * x = 36" by linarith
  then have "x = 6" by linarith
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

qed

  shows "f (f 1) = 3/7"

    using assms by auto
  then have "f 1 = 1/3"

  then have "f (f 1) = 1 / ((1/3) + 2)"
    using assms by auto
  then have "f (f 1) = 1 / (7/3)"
    by auto
  then have "f (f 1) = 3/7"
    by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> -1"

proof -
  have "(a - c) / (a + 1) = b" using assms by simp
  then have "(a - c) = b * (a + 1)" by (smt (verit) assms(1) nonzero_eq_divide_eq)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma solve_equation_simplification:
  fixes a b c x::real
  assumes "x \<noteq> -a"
  assumes "(a - b) / (x + a) = c"
  shows "a - b = c * (x + a)"
proof -

  then have "a - b = c * (x + a)" by (metis add.commute add_eq_0_iff assms(1) frac_eq_eq nonzero_divide_eq_eq)

  finally show ?thesis by simp

qed

lemma mod_arithmetic:
  fixes a b c d m :: nat
  assumes "a = b * c + d"
  shows "a mod m = (b * c + d) mod m"
proof -
  have "a mod m = ((b * c + d) mod m)"
    using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma multi_distrib_complex:
  fixes a b c d :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d"
proof -
  have "a * (c + d) = a * c + a * d" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * (c + d)" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma hilbert_choice_property:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij f"
  shows "f (Hilbert_Choice.inv f x) = x"
proof -
  have "f (Hilbert_Choice.inv f x) = x" by (metis assms bij_inv_eq_iff)
  thus ?thesis .
qed

lemma f_2_eq_inv_f_2:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij f"
    and "f 2 = (Hilbert_Choice.inv f) 2"
  shows "f (f 2) = 2"
proof -
  have "f (f 2) = f ((Hilbert_Choice.inv f) 2)" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = 2" using hilbert_choice_property assms by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma inverse_function_property:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij f"
  shows "f (Hilbert_Choice.inv f x) = x" "Hilbert_Choice.inv f (f x) = x"
proof -
  show "f (Hilbert_Choice.inv f x) = x"
    by (metis assms bij_inv_eq_iff)
  show "Hilbert_Choice.inv f (f x) = x"
    by (metis assms bij_inv_eq_iff)
qed

fun \<sigma> :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" where
  "\<sigma> x = 3 * x + 2"

fun inv_\<sigma> :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" where
  "inv_\<sigma> x = (x - 2) / 3"

lemma inverse_function_property:
  assumes "bij \<sigma>"
  shows "\<forall> x. inv_\<sigma> (\<sigma> x) = x"
proof
  fix x :: real
  show "inv_\<sigma> (\<sigma> x) = x"
  proof -
    have "inv_\<sigma> (\<sigma> x) = x" by auto
    thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
qed

lemma inverse_function_property_2:
  assumes "bij \<sigma>"
  shows "\<forall> x. \<sigma> (inv_\<sigma> x) = x"
proof
  fix x :: real
  show "\<sigma> (inv_\<sigma> x) = x"
  proof -
    have "\<sigma> (inv_\<sigma> x) = x" by (auto simp: field_simps)
    thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
qed

lemma inverse_function_property3:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij f"
  shows "Hilbert_Choice.inv f x = y \<longleftrightarrow> f y = x"
proof
  assume "Hilbert_Choice.inv f x = y"
  then have "f y = x" by (metis assms bijection.intro bijection.inv_right)
  thus "f y = x" .
next
  assume "f y = x"
  then have "Hilbert_Choice.inv f x = y" by (metis assms bijection.bij_inv bijection.intro bijection.inv_right inv_inv_eq)
  thus "Hilbert_Choice.inv f x = y" .
qed

lemma apply_inverse_function_property:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij f"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv f 2 = 10"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv f 10 = 1"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv f 1 = 2"
  shows "f 10 = 2"
proof -
  have "f 10 = f (Hilbert_Choice.inv f 2)" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = 2" using assms(1) by (metis inverse_function_property3 assms(2) assms(3) assms(4))
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5" and "a + b = 2"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  have "a = 2 - b" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "3 * (2 - b) + 2 * b = 5" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "6 - 3 * b + 2 * b = 5" by simp
  then have "- b = -1" by simp
  then have "b = 1" by simp
  then have "a = 1" using assms(2) by simp
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>b = 1\<close>)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5"
    and "a + b = 2" 
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  from assms(2) have "a = 2 - b" by simp
  then have "3 * (2 - b) + 2 * b = 5"
    using assms(1) by auto
  then have "6 - 3 * b + 2 * b = 5" by simp
  then have "- b = -1" by simp
  then have "b = 1" by simp
  then have "a = 2 - b" by (metis \<open>a = 2 - b\<close> uminus_add_conv_diff)
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>b = 1\<close> add_right_imp_eq assms(2) diff_minus_eq_add diff_numeral_special(11))
qed

lemma sum_of_equations:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25"
proof -
  have "(3 * a + b + c) + (a + 3 * b + c) + (a + b + 3 * c) = (-3) + 9 + 19"
    using assms by simp
  then have "3 * a + b + c + a + 3 * b + c + a + b + 3 * c = 25"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma isolate_y:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "sqrt (19 + 3 * y) = 7"
  shows "3 * y = 30"
proof -
  have "19 + 3 * y = 7^2" using assms by (smt (verit) real_le_lsqrt real_sqrt_ge_0_iff real_sqrt_zero square_root_inequality zero_le_power2)
  then have "19 + 3 * y = 49" by simp
  then have "3 * y = 30" by (simp add: diff_add_inverse2)

qed

theorem mathd_algebra_263:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "0 \<le> 19 + 3 * y"
    and "sqrt (19 + 3 * y) = 7" 
  shows "y = 10"
proof -
  have "19 + 3 * y = 7^2" using assms(2) by (smt (verit) assms(1) real_sqrt_pow2_iff)
  then have "19 + 3 * y = 49" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  then have "3 * y = 30" by (simp add: diff_eq_eq)
  then have "y = 10" by (simp add: divide_pos_pos)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_263:

  assumes "0 \<le> 19 + 3 * y"
    and "sqrt (19 + 3 * y) = 7" 
  shows "y = 10"

  then have "3 * y = 7^2 - 19" using assms by (smt (verit) real_sqrt_pow2)
  then have "y = (7^2 - 19) / 3" by (simp add: divide_pos_pos)
  then have "y = 10" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_263:

  shows "(11 powr (1 / 4)) powr (6 * x + 2) = 121 / 25"
proof -
  have "((11 powr (1 / 4)) powr (6 * x + 2)) = ((11 powr (1 / 4)) powr (6 * x - 6)) * ((11 powr (1 / 4)) powr 8)"
    by (smt (verit) powr_add powr_realpow)
  also have "... = ((11 powr (1 / 4)) powr (3 * x - 3)) powr 2 * (11 powr (8 / 4))"
    using powr_powr by auto
  also have "... = ((1 / 5)) powr 2 * (11 powr 2)"
    using assms by auto
  also have "... = (1 / 25) * (121)"
    using powr_realpow powr_numeral by eval
  also have "... = 121 / 25"
    by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

  fixes x :: nat
  assumes "x = 8 * 9^2 + 5 * 9 + 2"
  shows "x = 8 * 81 + 5 * 9 + 2"
proof -

  then have "x = 8 * 81 + 5 * 9 + 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

  then show ?thesis by simp

lemma exponent_rule2:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "(a powr b) powr b = a powr (b^2)"
proof -
  have "(a powr b) powr b = a powr (b * b)"
    by (smt (verit) powr_powr)
  then have "a powr (b * b) = a powr (b^2)"
    by (metis power2_eq_square)
  then show ?thesis by (metis exponent_rule)
qed

fun abs :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" where
  "abs x = (if x \<ge> 0 then x else -x)"

lemma abs_negation_property:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "abs (-x) = abs x"
proof -
  have "abs (-x) = (if -x \<ge> 0 then -x else -(-x))"
    by auto
  also have "... = (if x \<le> 0 then -x else -(-x))"
    by (simp add: mult.assoc)
  also have "... = (if x \<le> 0 then -x else x)"
    by (simp add: mult.commute)
  also have "... = abs x"
    by auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma complex_number_arithmetic:
  fixes z1 z2 :: complex
  assumes "z1 = a + b * \<i>" and "z2 = c + d * \<i>"
  shows "z1 * z2 = (a * c - b * d) + (a * d + b * c) * \<i>"
proof -

  also have "... = a*c + a*d*\<i> + b*\<i>*c + b*\<i>*d*\<i>" by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  fixes s :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"

lemma recursive_seq_backward_calculation:
  fixes s :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<And>n. s (n + 2) = s (n + 1) + s n"
  shows "s (n + 1) = s (n + 2) - s n"
proof -

  then have "s (n + 1) = s (n + 2) - s n" by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis assms)
qed

  assumes "a = 4"
  shows "a^n / a^(n+1) = 1 / a"
proof -

  have "a^(n+1) = 4^(n+1)" using assms by simp
  have "a^n / a^(n+1) = 4^n / 4^(n+1)" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 1 / 4" using assms by (simp add: power_divide)

  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_412:

  assumes "x + y = 25"
    and "x - y = 11"
  shows "x = 18"
proof -

  then have "2*x = 25 + 11" by (smt add_diff_cancel_left')
  then have "2*x = 36" by (simp add: add_pos_pos)

  assumes h0 : "x + y = a"
    and h1 : "x - y = b"
  shows "x = (a + b) / 2"
proof -
  have "x + y = a" and "x - y = b" using assms by auto
  then have "2*x = a + b" by (smt add_diff_cancel_left')
  then have "x = (a + b) / 2" by (simp add: divide_pos_pos)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -

    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)

qed

theorem system_of_equations:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "3 * y = x"
    and "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" 
  shows "x = 3 \<and> y = 1"
proof -
  have "3 * y = x" and "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" using assms by auto
  then have "6 * y + 5 * y = 11" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "11 * y = 11" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then have "y = 1" by (simp add: divide_pos_pos)
  then have "3 * 1 = x" using assms(1) by auto
  then have "x = 3" by (simp add: mult_1)
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>y = 1\<close>)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_432:
  fixes a b c :: real 
  shows "(a + b) * (c * a - d) = c * a^2 - d * a + b * c * a - b * d"
proof -
  have c0: "(a + b) * (c * a - d) = (a + b) * c * a - (a + b) * d"
    by sos
  also have "... = c * a * a + b * c * a - d * a - d * b"
    by sos
  also have "... = c * a^2 + b * c * a - d * a - d * b"
    by sos
  also have "... = c * a^2 - d * a + b * c * a - d * b"
    by (smt (verit, best) add.commute)
  finally show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_432_3:
  fixes a b c :: real 
  shows "(a + b) * (c * a - d) = c * a^2 - d * a + b * c * a - d * b"
proof -
  have "-(((a^2 - a*(b+c)) + c*b) * d) + (a^2 - a*(b+c) + c*b) * a =
    -((a^2 - a*b - a*c + c*b) * d) + (a^2 - a*b - a*c + c*b) * a"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  thus ?thesis
    by sos
qed

  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"

  shows "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25"
proof -

    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

    using assms by simp

qed

lemma find_a_b_integer_solution:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes 
    "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9 \<and> b \<le> 9"
    "10 * a + b = 2 * (a + b)"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 8"
proof -
  have "10 * a + b = 2 * a + 2 * b"
    using assms by simp
  then have "8 * a = b"
    by (simp add: assms(1) diff_eq_eq)
  then have "8 * 1 = b"
    using assms by auto
  then have "b = 8"
    by simp
  then have "a = 1"
    using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by (metis \<open>b = 8\<close>)
qed

lemma system_of_linear_equations:
  fixes c d :: real
  assumes "c/3 + d/1 = 5" "d/3 + c/1 = 7"
  shows "c = 6 \<and> d = 3"
proof -
  have "c/3 + d/1 = 5" and "d/3 + c/1 = 7" using assms by auto
  then have "c/3 + d/1 + d/3 + c/1 = 5 + 7"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "(c + d)/1 + (d + c)/3 = 12"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "12/1 = 12/1"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "(c + d) + (d + c)/3 = 12"
    by (metis \<open>(c + d) / 1 + (d + c) / 3 = 12\<close> dbl_inc_simps(3) div_by_1)
  then have "(4/3)*(c + d) = 12"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "c + d = 9"
    by auto
  then have "c + d = 9" and "c + d = 9" using \<open>c + d = 9\<close> by auto
  then have "c + d = 9" by simp
  then have "c = 6" and "d = 3"
    using assms(1) assms(2) by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5"
    and "a + b = 2" 
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  from assms(2) have "a = 2 - b" by simp
  then have "3 * (2 - b) + 2 * b = 5"
    using assms(1) by auto
  then have "6 - 3 * b + 2 * b = 5" by simp
  then have "- b = -1" by simp
  then have "b = 1" by simp
  then have "a = 2 - b" by (metis \<open>a = 2 - b\<close> uminus_add_conv_diff)
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>b = 1\<close> add_right_imp_eq assms(2) diff_minus_eq_add diff_numeral_special(11))
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_432_generalized:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  shows "(a + b) * (c * d) = c * (a * d) + d * (b * c)"
proof -
  have c0: "(a + b) * (c * d) = (a + b) * c * d"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (a * c * d) + (b * c * d)"
    by sos
  also have "... = c * (a * d) + d * (b * c)"
    by auto
  finally show ?thesis
    by (smt (verit, best) distrib_left)
qed

  fixes y :: real
  assumes "6 - y = y - 12"

  then have "6 + 12 = y + y" by (smt add_diff_cancel_left')

  then have "b - a = a + d - a" by (simp add: algebra_simps)

qed

  shows "x = 14"

  have "-2 * x - 3 * ?w = -4" using assms(2) by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "9 * x + 12 * ?w - 8 * x - 12 * ?w = 30 - 16" using assms(1) assms(2) by (simp add: algebra_simps)

lemma substitute_variable:
  fixes x y z w :: real
  assumes "w = y - 3 * z"
  shows "3 * x + 4 * w = 3 * x + 4 * (y - 3 * z)"
proof -

theorem mathd_algebra_398:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and "9 * b = 20 * c"

proof -

  then have "a = (4/7) * (20/9) * c" using assms(2) by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "a = (80/63) * c" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

qed

lemma find_a_b_integer_solution:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes 
    "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9 \<and> b \<le> 9"
    "10 * a + b = 2 * (a + b)"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 8"
proof -
  have "10 * a + b = 2 * a + 2 * b" using assms by simp
  then have "10 * a - 2 * a = 2 * b - b" by simp
  then have "8 * a = b" by simp
  then have "b = 8 * a" by simp
  then have "b = 8" using assms by auto
  then have "a = 1" using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>b = 8\<close>)
qed

lemma find_a_b_integer_solution:

  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 8"

    using assms by simp
  then have "10 * a - 2 * a = 2 * b - b"
    by simp
  then have "8 * a = b"
    by simp
  then have "8 * 1 = b"
    using assms by auto
  then have "b = 8"

  then have "a = 1"

  then show ?thesis
    by (metis \<open>b = 8\<close>)
qed

  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes h0: "0 < x \<and> 0 < y \<and> 0 < z"

    and h2: "y + 1/z = 1"

proof -

    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>t = 4\<close> add_diff_cancel_left' assms(1) dbl_def dbl_inc_def dbl_inc_simps(5) dbl_simps(3) dbl_simps(5) inc.simps(1) mult_2 numeral_One)
qed

lemma power_eq_243:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "2 powr a = 32"
    and "a powr b = 125"
  shows "b powr a = 243"
proof -
  from assms(1) have "2 powr a = 2^5" by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then have "a = 5" using powr_realpow by (smt (verit) add_diff_inverse_nat bot_nat_0.extremum_uniqueI diff_is_0_eq' le_numeral_extra(4) less_numeral_extra(4) less_one log_pow_cancel log_powr_cancel nat_le_real_less nat_less_real_le numeral_Bit0 numeral_Bit1 numerals(1) of_nat_0_le_iff of_nat_1 of_nat_add of_nat_numeral)
  then have "125 = 5 powr b" using assms(2) by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then have "5 powr b = 5^3" using powr_realpow by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then have "b = 3" using powr_realpow by (smt (verit) add_diff_inverse_nat bot_nat_0.extremum_uniqueI diff_is_0_eq' le_numeral_extra(4) less_numeral_extra(4) less_one log_pow_cancel log_powr_cancel nat_le_real_less nat_less_real_le numeral_Bit0 numeral_Bit1 numerals(1) of_nat_0_le_iff of_nat_1 of_nat_add of_nat_numeral)
  then have "b powr a = 3 powr 5" by (metis \<open>a = 5\<close> semiring_norm(5))
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: powr_realpow)
qed

lemma even_number:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "even n = (n mod 2 = 0)"
proof -
  { assume "even n"
    then obtain k where "n = 2 * k" by auto
    hence "n mod 2 = (2 * k) mod 2" by simp
    also have "... = 0" by auto
    finally have "n mod 2 = 0" by simp
  } moreover
  { assume "n mod 2 = 0"
    then have "even n" by auto
  }
  ultimately show "even n = (n mod 2 = 0)" by auto
qed

data/full_data/test/mathd_algebra_80.jso:
theorem mathd_algebra_440:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "3 / 2 / 3 = x / 10"
  shows "x = 5"
proof -
  have "3/2/3 = x/10" using assms by auto
  have "x = 3/2/3 * 10" using assms(1) by auto
  have "x = 1/2 * 10" by (smt (verit) \<open>x = 3 / 2 / 3 * 10\<close> divide_divide_eq_left' nonzero_divide_mult_cancel_left)
  then have "x = 5" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

fun f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" where
  "f x = 5 * x + 4"

theorem mathd_algebra_171:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x = 1"
  shows "f x = 9"
proof -
  have "f x = 5 * x + 4" by auto
  also have "... = 5 * 1 + 4" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 9" by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_440:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "3 / 2 / 3 = x / 10"
  shows "x = 5"
proof -
  have "3/2/3 = x/10" using assms by auto
  hence "1/2 = x/10" by auto
  hence "x = 5" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_80:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> -1"
      and "(x - 9) / (x + 1) = 2"
    shows "x = -11"
proof -
  have "x - 9 = 2 * (x + 1)" using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "x - 9 = 2 * x + 2" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x - 2 * x = 9 + 2" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "-x = 11" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x = -11" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma count_divisible_by_20:
  shows "card {x::nat. 20 dvd x \<and> 15 \<le> x \<and> x < 86} = 4"
proof -

lemma
  fixes y::real
  assumes "y > 0"
  shows "(9 * y^2 + 4) >= 12 * y"
proof -
  have "(3 * y - 2)^2 >= 0"
    by auto
  then have "(3 * y - 2) * (3 * y - 2) >= 0"
    by simp
  then have "9 * y^2 - 12 * y + 4 >= 0"
    by sos
  then have "9 * y^2 + 4 >= 12 * y"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis
    using `y > 0` by simp
qed

lemma least_multiple_of_20:
  fixes x::nat
  assumes "20 dvd x" "15 \<le> x"
  shows "20 * 1 \<le> x"
proof -
  from assms(1) obtain k where "x = 20 * k" using dvdE by blast
  with assms(2) have "15 \<le> 20 * k" by simp
  then have "1 \<le> k" by auto
  then have "20 * 1 \<le> 20 * k" by auto
  then show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>x = 20 * k\<close>)
qed

qed

lemma mod_mult:
  fixes a b c n :: nat
  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b" "0 < n" "c > 0"
  shows "(a * c) mod n = ((a mod n) * (c mod n)) mod n"
proof -
  have "(a * c) mod n = ((a mod n) * c) mod n"
    using assms(1) mod_mult_left_eq by metis
  also have "... = ((a mod n) * (c mod n)) mod n"
    using assms(4) mod_mult_right_eq by metis
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma mod_add:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "c > 0"
  shows "(a + b) mod c = ((a mod c) + (b mod c)) mod c"
proof -

  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mod_add:
  fixes a b c d m :: nat
  assumes "a mod m = b" and "c mod m = d"

proof -

    by (simp add: mod_add_eq)
  also have "... = (b + d) mod m"
    using assms(1, 2) by (simp add: mod_add_eq)
  finally show ?thesis by (metis assms mod_add_cong)
qed

  then have "(a + b + c) mod 10 = (496 mod 10)" by simp
  then have "(a + b + c) mod 10 = 6" by auto

data/full_data/test/mathd_numbertheory_4:
theorem mathd_numbertheory_483:
  fixes a :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
  assumes "a 1 = 1"
    and "a 2 = 1"
    and "\<forall> n. a (n + 2) = a (n + 1) + a n" 
    and "\<forall> n. a n>0"
  shows "(a 100) mod 4 = 3"
proof -
  have "a n = a (n mod 4) + a (Suc (n mod 4))" for n
    by (metis One_nat_def Suc_1 add.commute add.right_neutral add_Suc_right assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) assms(4) less_nat_zero_code nat.distinct(1) old.nat.exhaust old.nat.inject)
  hence "a 100 = a (100 mod 4) + a (Suc (100 mod 4))"
    by (smt (verit) Suc_eq_plus1)
  also have "... = a 0 + a 1"
    by auto
  also have "... = 1 + 1"
    by (smt (verit) Nat.diff_add_assoc Nat.diff_diff_right add.commute add_diff_inverse_nat add_lessD1 add_mono1 assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) assms(4) diff_is_0_eq' le_numeral_extra(3) le_numeral_extra(4) less_numeral_extra(1) less_numeral_extra(4) nat_1_add_1 nat_power_less_imp_less not_one_less_zero power_one_right zero_less_one_class.zero_le_one)
  also have "... mod 4 = 3"
    by (metis One_nat_def Suc_0_mod_numeral(2) Suc_1 \<open>\<And>n. a n = a (n mod 4) + a (Suc (n mod 4))\<close> assms(1) assms(2) n_not_Suc_n plus_1_eq_Suc)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma find_remainder_with_initial_values:
  fixes a :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
  assumes "a 1 = 1"
    and "a 2 = 1"
    and "\<forall> n. a (n + 2) = a (n + 1) + a n" 
    and "\<forall> n. a n>0"
  shows "(a 100) mod 4 = (a (100 mod 6)) mod 4"
proof -
  have "a 100 mod 4 = a (100 mod 3) mod 4" using assms(3) by (metis Suc_1 add_2_eq_Suc' add_Suc_right add_Suc_shift add_cancel_left_left add_cancel_left_right assms(1) assms(2) assms(4) neq0_conv numeral_1_eq_Suc_0 old.nat.inject one_eq_numeral_iff)
  also have "... = a (100 mod 6) mod 4" using assms(3) by (metis One_nat_def Suc_1 Zero_not_Suc add.commute add.right_neutral add_Suc_right assms(1) assms(2) assms(4) less_nat_zero_code nat.inject not0_implies_Suc)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_517 :
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "a mod 4 = 1"
    and "b mod 4 = 2"
    and "c mod 4 = 3"
  shows "(a * b * c) mod 4 = 2"
proof -
  have "(a * b * c) mod 4 = (a mod 4 * b mod 4 * c mod 4) mod 4"
    by (metis assms(1) comm_monoid_mult_class.mult_1 mod_mod_trivial mod_mult_left_eq mult.comm_neutral mult.commute mult.left_commute)
  also have "... = (1 * 2 * 3) mod 4"
    using assms by (smt (verit) One_nat_def Suc_0_mod_numeral(2) Suc_1 Suc_nat_number_of_add calculation comm_monoid_mult_class.mult_1 diff_Suc_numeral diff_mult_distrib diff_mult_distrib2 inc.simps(1) mod_mult_eq mult.commute mult_delta_right mult_eq_if mult_numeral_1_right numerals(1) plus_1_eq_Suc pred_numeral_def pred_numeral_inc pred_numeral_simps(1) semiring_norm(2) zero_neq_one)
  also have "... = 6 mod 4"
    by simp
  also have "... = 2"
    by eval
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_483:
  fixes a :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
  assumes "a 1 = 1"
    and "a 2 = 1"
    and "\<forall> n. a (n + 2) = a (n + 1) + a n" 
    and "\<forall> n. a n>0"
  shows "(a 100) mod 4 = 3"
proof -
  have "a 100 mod 4 = a (100 mod 3) mod 4" using assms(3) by (metis Suc_1 add_2_eq_Suc' add_Suc_right add_Suc_shift add_cancel_left_left add_cancel_left_right assms(1) assms(2) assms(4) neq0_conv numeral_1_eq_Suc_0 old.nat.inject one_eq_numeral_iff)
  also have "... = a 1 mod 4" using assms(3) by auto
  also have "... = 1 mod 4" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = 1" by auto
  also have "... = 3 mod 4" by (metis One_nat_def Suc_1 add.commute add.right_neutral add_Suc_right assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) assms(4) gr0_implies_Suc less_nat_zero_code old.nat.inject zero_less_Suc)
  finally show ?thesis by simp

lemma multiple_of_three_is_multiple_of_three_plus_three:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "3 dvd n"
  shows "3 dvd (n + 3)"
proof -
  from assms obtain k where "n = 3 * k" using dvdE by blast
  then have "n + 3 = 3 * k + 3" by auto
  then have "n + 3 = 3 * (k + 1)" by auto
  then show ?thesis using dvd_def by blast
qed

lemma multiple_of_three_is_multiple_of_three_plus_three:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "3 dvd n"
  shows "3 dvd (n + 3)"
proof -
  from assms obtain k where "n = 3 * k" by (blast elim: dvdE)
  then have "n + 3 = 3 * k + 3" by simp
  also have "\<dots> = 3 * (k + 1)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show "3 dvd (n + 3)" by (rule dvdI)
qed

proof -
  have "log a (b * c) = log a b + log a c" using assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) log_def by (metis add_divide_eq_if_simps(2) divide_cancel_right ln_one log_mult)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma sum_squares_bound_general:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x >= 0" "y >= 0"
  shows "x^2 + y^2 >= 2 * x * y"
  using assms by (simp add: sum_squares_bound)

lemma am_gm_divide_form_general:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x > 0" "y > 0"
  shows "x/y + y/x >= 2"
proof -
  have c0:"sqrt(x/y) >= 0"
    using assms by simp
  have c1:"sqrt(y/x) >= 0"
    using assms by simp
  have "x/y + y/x >= 2 * sqrt(x/y) * sqrt(y/x)"
    using sum_squares_bound_general[of "sqrt(x/y)" "sqrt(y/x)"] c0 c1 by simp
  have "2 * sqrt(x/y) * sqrt(y/x) = 2 * sqrt(x/y * y/x)"
    by (metis ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) real_sqrt_mult times_divide_eq_right)
  then have "... = 2"
    using assms(1) assms(2) by fastforce
  show ?thesis
    using \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y * y / x) = 2\<close> \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y) * sqrt (y / x) = 2 * sqrt (x / y * y / x)\<close> \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y) * sqrt (y / x) \<le> x / y + y / x\<close> by presburger
qed

lemma am_gm_general:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x >= 0" "y >= 0"
  shows "x^2 + y^2 >= 2*x*y"
  using am_gm_divide_form_general[of x y] assms by sos

lemma mod_divisibility:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a mod b = 0"
  shows "b dvd a"
proof -
  have "a = (a div b) * b + (a mod b)"
    by auto
  then have "a = (a div b) * b + 0"
    using assms by simp
  then have "a = (a div b) * b"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis by (metis assms less_numeral_extra(3) mod_greater_zero_iff_not_dvd)

theorem numbertheory_sqmod3in01d:
  fixes a :: int
  shows "a^2 mod 3 = 0 \<or> a^2 mod 3 = 1"
proof -
  obtain b::int where c0: "b = a mod 3" by auto
  have c1: "b \<ge> 0 \<and> b \<le> 2"
    by (smt (verit) Euclidean_Division.pos_mod_bound c0 mod_int_pos_iff uminus_int_code(1) zle_add1_eq_le)
  hence c2: "a^2 mod 3 = b^2 mod 3" using c0
    by (smt (verit) power_mod)
  then show ?thesis
  proof (cases "b=0")
    case True
    have "a^2 mod 3 = 0" using True c0 by auto
    then show ?thesis by auto
  next
    case c3: False
    then show ?thesis
    proof (cases "b=1")
      case True
      have "a^2 mod 3 = 1" using True c0
        by (metis c1 c2 c3 mod_by_1 mod_pos_pos_trivial one_le_numeral order_less_le power_one)
      then show ?thesis by auto
    next
      case False
      have "b = 2" using c1 c3 False by auto
      hence "a^2 mod 3 = 2^2 mod 3" using c2 by auto
      also have "... = 1" by auto
      finally have "a^2 mod 3 = 1" by auto
      then show ?thesis by auto
    qed
  qed
qed

lemma square_mod_8:
  fixes a b :: int
  shows "(a^2 + b^2) mod 8 = (a^2 mod 8 + b^2 mod 8) mod 8"
proof -

    by (simp add: mod_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma odd_square_mod8_eq1:
  fixes a :: int
  assumes "odd a"
  shows "a^2 mod 8 = 1"
proof -
  have "a mod 8 = 1 \<or> a mod 8 = 3 \<or> a mod 8 = 5 \<or> a mod 8 = 7"
    using assms by presburger
  then show ?thesis
  proof (cases "a mod 8 = 1")
    case True
    have "a^2 mod 8 = 1^2 mod 8" using True by (smt (verit) power_mod)
    also have "... = 1" by auto
    finally show ?thesis by auto
  next
    case False
    then have "a mod 8 = 3 \<or> a mod 8 = 5 \<or> a mod 8 = 7" by (metis \<open>a mod 8 = 1 \<or> a mod 8 = 3 \<or> a mod 8 = 5 \<or> a mod 8 = 7\<close> int_ops(3))
    then show ?thesis
    proof (cases "a mod 8 = 3")
      case True
      have "a^2 mod 8 = 3^2 mod 8" using True by (smt (verit) power_mod)
      also have "... = 9 mod 8" by auto
      also have "... = 1" by auto
      finally show ?thesis by auto
    next
      case False
      then have "a mod 8 = 5 \<or> a mod 8 = 7" by (metis \<open>a mod 8 = 3 \<or> a mod 8 = 5 \<or> a mod 8 = 7\<close> of_nat_numeral)
      then show ?thesis
      proof (cases "a mod 8 = 5")
        case True
        have "a^2 mod 8 = 5^2 mod 8" using True by (smt (verit) power_mod)
        also have "... = 25 mod 8" by auto
        also have "... = 1" by auto
        finally show ?thesis by auto
      next
        case False
        then have "a mod 8 = 7" by (metis \<open>a mod 8 = 5 \<or> a mod 8 = 7\<close> int_ops(3))
        have "a^2 mod 8 = 7^2 mod 8" using False by (metis \<open>a mod 8 = 7\<close> power_mod semiring_norm(5))
        also have "... = 49 mod 8" by auto
        also have "... = 1" by auto
        finally show ?thesis by auto
      qed
    qed
  qed
qed

lemma exponentiation:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a = 8"
  shows "(16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3)) powr (1 / 3) = 4"
proof -
  have "a = 8" using assms by simp
  then have "a^2 = 8^2" by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then have "a^2 = 64" by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then have "16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3) = 16 * 64 powr (1 / 3)" by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then have "16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3) = 16 * 4" by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then have "16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3) = 64" by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then have "(16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3)) powr (1 / 3) = 64 powr (1 / 3)" by simp
  then have "(16 * (a^2) powr (1 / 3)) powr (1 / 3) = 4" by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma sum_of_squares:
  fixes y::real
  shows "(9 * y^2 + 4) \<ge> 12 * y"
proof -
  have "9 * y^2 + 4 - 12 * y \<ge> 0"
  proof -
    have "9 * y^2 + 4 - 12 * y = (3 * y - 2)^2"
      by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
    thus "9 * y^2 + 4 - 12 * y \<ge> 0"
      by simp
  qed
  thus "(9 * y^2 + 4) \<ge> 12 * y"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

theory aime_1983_p2

begin




theorem aime_1983_p2:
  fixes x p ::real and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0: "0 < p \<and> p < 15"
      and h1: "p \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 15"
      and h2: "f x = abs (x - p) + abs (x - 15) + abs (x - p - 15)" 
    shows "15 \<le> f x"

    sledgehammer
  have c2:"15-x \<ge> 0" using h0 h1
    sledgehammer
  have c3:"15+p-x \<ge> 0" using h0 h1
    sledgehammer
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  have c4: "f x = x-p + 15-x + 15+p-x"
    using c1 c2 c3 h2
    sledgehammer
  have c5: "f x = 30 - x"
    using c4 by simp
  
  
  
  
  show ?thesis unfolding c5
    using h1 sledgehammer
qed

end

theory aime_1989_p8
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem aime_1989_p8:
  fixes a b c d e f g :: real
  assumes "a + 4 * b + 9 * c + 16 * d + 25 * e + 36 * f + 49 * g = 1"
    and "4 * a + 9 * b + 16 * c + 25 * d + 36 * e + 49 * f + 64 * g = 12"
    and "9 * a + 16 * b + 25 * c + 36 * d + 49 * e + 64 * f + 81 * g = 123"
  shows "16 * a + 25 * b + 36 * c + 49 * d + 64 * e + 81 * f + 100 * g = 334"
proof -
  have c0: "a + 4 * b + 9 * c + 16 * d + 25 * e + 36 * f + 49 * g = 1" and
         c1: "4 * a + 9 * b + 16 * c + 25 * d + 36 * e + 49 * f + 64 * g = 12" and
         c2: "9 * a + 16 * b + 25 * c + 36 * d + 49 * e + 64 * f + 81 * g = 123" using assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) by auto
  have c3: "(a + 4 * b + 9 * c + 16 * d + 25 * e + 36 * f + 49 * g) + (3 * (4 * a + 9 * b + 16 * c + 25 * d + 36 * e + 49 * f + 64 * g) - (9 * a + 16 * b + 25 * c + 36 * d + 49 * e + 64 * f + 81 * g)) = 1 + 3 * 12 - 123"
    using c0 c1 c2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have c4: "16 * a + 25 * b + 36 * c + 49 * d + 64 * e + 81 * f + 100 * g = 334"
    by (smt (verit) c1 c2)
  show ?thesis using c4 by simp
qed

end
```

## Formal Proof
```isabelle
theory aime_1990_p15
imports Complex_Main
begin

lemma relationship:
  fixes a b x y :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y = 3"
    and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7"
    and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16"
    and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42"
  shows "(a * x^5 + b * y^5) + (x * y) * (a * x^3 + b * y^3) = (a * x^4 + b * y^4) * (x + y)"
proof -
  have "(a * x^5 + b * y^5) + (x * y) * (a * x^3 + b * y^3) = (a * x^4 + b * y^4) * (x + y)"
    using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b x y :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y = 3"
    and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7"
    and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16"
    and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42"
  shows "(a * x^4 + b * y^4) * (x + y) = (a * x^5 + b * y^5) + (x * y) * (a * x^3 + b * y^3)"
  by sos

lemma solve_for_ax5_by5:
  fixes a b x y :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y = 3"
    and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7"
    and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16"
    and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42"
  shows "a * x^5 + b * y^5 = 20"
proof -
  have "a * x + b * y = 3" and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7" and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16" and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42" using assms by auto
  then have "a * x^5 + b * y^5 = 20" by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem aime_1990_p15:
  fixes a b x y :: real
  assumes "a * x + b * y = 3"
    and "a * x^2 + b * y^2 = 7"
    and "a * x^3 + b * y^3 = 16"
    and "a * x^4 + b * y^4 = 42"
  shows "a * x^5 + b * y^5 = 20"
proof -
  have "a * x^5 + b * y^5 = 20" using assms solve_for_ax5_by5 by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```
This formal proof follows the steps outlined in the informal proof, using algebraic manipulations and the relationship derived from the given equations to obtain the final result of $ax^5 + by^5 = 20$.

theorem algebra_2varlineareq_fp3zeq11_3tfm1m5zeqn68_feqn10_zeq7:
  fixes f z::complex
  assumes h0: "f + 3*z = 11"
      and h1: "3*(f - 1) - 5*z = -68" 
    shows "f = -10 \<and> z = 7"
proof -
  
  have c0: "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -33"
    using h0 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

    using c0 h1 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

    using c1 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

    using c2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

    using c3 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

    using h0 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have c6: "f + 21 = 11"
    using c5 c4 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have c7: "f = -10"
    using c6 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

```isabelle
theory algebra_absxm1pabsxpabsxp1eqxp2_0leqxleq1
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem algebra_absxm1pabsxpabsxp1eqxp2_0leqxleq1:
  fixes x ::real
  assumes "abs (x - 1) + abs x + abs (x + 1) = x + 2" 
  shows "0 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 1"
proof -
  
  show ?thesis
  proof (cases "x < -1")
    case True
    then show ?thesis
      using assms by (simp add: abs_if)
  next
    case False
    then show ?thesis
    proof (cases "x < 1")
      case True
      then show ?thesis
        using assms by (simp add: abs_if)
    next
      case False
      then show ?thesis
        using assms by (simp add: abs_if)
    qed
  qed
qed
end
```

This formal proof shows that for any real number $x$, if $|x-1| + |x| + |x+1| = x + 2$, then $0 \leq x \leq 1$.

theorem algebra_apbpceq2_abpbcpcaeq1_aleq1on3anbleq1ancleq4on3:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<le> b \<and> b \<le> c"
    and "a + b + c = 2"
    and "a * b + b * c + c * a = 1" 
  shows "0 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 1 / 3 \<and> 1 / 3 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 1 \<and> 1 \<le> c \<and> c \<le> 4 / 3"

  have "a \<le> 1 / 3" using assms by sos
  have "1 / 3 \<le> b" using assms by sos
  have "b \<le> 1" using assms by sos
  have "1 \<le> c" using assms by sos
  have "c \<le> 4 / 3" using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>0 \<le> a\<close> \<open>1 / 3 \<le> b\<close> \<open>1 \<le> c\<close> \<open>a \<le> 1 / 3\<close> \<open>b \<le> 1\<close>)
qed

```isabelle
theory algebra_apbpceq2_abpbcpcaeq1_aleq1on3anbleq1ancleq4on3
  imports Complex_Main algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d
begin


theorem algebra_apbpceq2_abpbcpcaeq1_aleq1on3anbleq1ancleq4on3:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<le> b \<and> b \<le> c"
    and "a + b + c = 2"
    and "a * b + b * c + c * a = 1" 
  shows "0 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 1 / 3 \<and> 1 / 3 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 1 \<and> 1 \<le> c \<and> c \<le> 4 / 3"
proof -
  have "(a + b + c)^2 = (a + b + c) * (a + b + c)" by auto
  also have "... = a^2 + a * b + a * c + b * a + b^2 + b * c + c * a + c^2" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + 2 * (a * b + b * c + c * a)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + 2 * 1" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 2" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (a + b + c)^2" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally have "a^2 + b^2 + c^2 = 2" by simp
  then have "0 \<le> a" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "0 \<le> b" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapown2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "0 \<le> c" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapown2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "a + b + c = 2" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "a + b = 2 - c" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "c + b = 2 - a" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "a + c = 2 - b" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "a^2 + b^2 + c^2 = 2" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "a^2 + (2 - a - c)^2 + c^2 = 2" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "a^2 + 4 - 4a - 4c + 2ac + c^2 = 2" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "2ac = 2a + 2c" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "2ac - 2a - 2c = 0" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "(a - c)^2 = 0" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "a - c = 0" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "a = c" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "b = 1 - a" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "1 - a = b" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "a = 1 - b" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "a = 1 - b" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)
  have "1 - b = a" using algebra_apbon2pownleqapownpbpowon2_3d assms by (metis (no_types) assms(2) le_add_diff_inverse2)

theory algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpamblt1
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpamblt1:
  fixes a b:: real
  assumes h0: "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "a * b + (a - b) \<le> 1"
proof -
  
  have h1: "(a - b - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" sledgehammer
  
  
  have h2: "(a - b - 1)^2 = a^2 - a*b - a - a*b + b^2 + b - a + b + 1"
    sledgehammer
  
  
  have h3: "a^2 - a*b - a - a*b + b^2 + b - a + b + 1 = 2 - 2*a*b - 2*a + 2*b"
    using h0 by simp
  
  
  have h4: "2 - 2*a*b - 2*a + 2*b \<ge> 0" using h3 sledgehammer
  
  
  have h5: "1 - a*b - a + b \<ge> 0" using h4 by simp
  
  
  have h6: "a*b + (a - b) \<le> 1" using h5 by simp
  
  
  show ?thesis using h6 sledgehammer
qed

end
```

theorem amc12a_2002_p6:

## Step 1: Simplify the problem
We are given that $x + y = 17402$ and $10$ divides $x$. This means that $x$ can be written as $10k$, where $k$ is a natural number. We are also given that $x \div 10 = y$, which means that $y = k$. Our goal is to find the difference between $x$ and $y$, which is $x - y$. To do this, we can use the fact that $x + y = 17402$ and $y = k$ to find $x$.

## Step 2: Find x
We know that $x + y = 17402$ and $y = k$. We can substitute $y = k$ into the equation to get $x + k = 17402$. Since $x$ can be written as $10k$, we can substitute this into the equation to get $10k + k = 17402$. This simplifies to $11k = 17402$.

## Step 3: Solve for k
To find $k$, we can divide both sides of the equation $11k = 17402$ by $11$. This gives us $k = 17402 \div 11$, which is equal to $1582$.

## Step 4: Find x
Now that we know $k = 1582$, we can find $x$ by multiplying $k$ by $10$. This gives us $x = 10 \times 1582 = 15820$.

## Step 5: Find y
We know that $y = k$, so $y = 1582$.

## Step 6: Find the difference between x and y
Finally, we can find the difference between $x$ and $y$ by subtracting $y$ from $x$. This gives us $x - y = 15820 - 1582 = 14238$.

## Formal proof

```isabelle
theory amc12a_2021_p3
imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem amc12a_2021_p3:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes h0: "x + y = 17402"
    and h1: "10 dvd x"
    and h2: "x div 10 = y"
  shows "x - y = 14238"
proof -
  
  have c0: "10 dvd x" using h1 by simp

  
  have c1: "x = 10 * y" using h2 by simp

  
  have c2: "y = 1582" using c1 h0 by (metis (no_types) nat_less_le)
  
  
  have c3: "x = 10 * 1582" using c1 c2 by auto

  
  have c4: "y = 1582" using c2 by simp

  
  have c5: "x - y = 15820 - 1582" using c3 c4 by auto

  
  show ?thesis using c5 by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory amc12b_2002_p19
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma real_number_properties:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a * (b + c) = b * (c + a)"
  shows "a * b + a * c = b * c + a * b"
proof -
  from assms have "a * (b + c) = b * (c + a)" by simp
  then have "a * b + a * c = b * c + b * a" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a * b + a * c = b * c + a * b" by (simp add: ac_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


lemma sum_of_three_equations:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a * (b + c) = 152" "b * (c + a) = 162" "c * (a + b) = 170"
  shows "2 * (a * b + b * c + c * a) = 484"
proof -
  have "2 * (a * b + b * c + c * a) = a * (b + c) + b * (c + a) + c * (a + b)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 152 + 162 + 170" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 484" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem amc12b_2002_p19:
  fixes a b c::real
  assumes h0: "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and h1: "a * (b + c) = 152"
    and h2: "b * (c + a) = 162"
    and h3: "c * (a + b) = 170"
  shows "a * b * c = 720"
proof -
  
  have "2 * (a * b + b * c + c * a) = 484" using assms by (rule sum_of_three_equations)

  
  then have "a * b + b * c + c * a = 242" by (simp add: divide_real_def)

  
  then have "b * c = 90" and "c * a = 80" and "a * b = 72" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  then have "a^2 * b^2 * c^2 = 90 * 80 * 72" by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  then have "a^2 * b^2 * c^2 = 720^2" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

  
  then have "a * b * c = 720" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

  show ?thesis by (simp add: h0)
qed

end
```
The final answer is 720.

theorem amc12b_2002_p2:
  fixes x ::int
  assumes h0: "x = 4" 
  shows "(3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1) - (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x) + 1 = 11"
proof -

            (3 * x - 2) * (4 * x + 1 - 4 * x) + 1"

  then have "\<dots> = (3 * x - 2) * 1 + 1"
    by (smt (verit) distrib_right)
  
  then have "\<dots> = 3 * x - 2 + 1"
    by (simp add: mult.assoc)
  
  then have "\<dots> = 3 * 4 - 2 + 1"
    using h0 by auto
  
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: mult.assoc)
qed

end

theory amc12b_2020_p6
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Computational_Algebra.Nat.thy"
begin


theorem amc12b_2020_p6:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "9 \<le> n" 
  shows "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (fact (n + 2) 
              - fact (n + 1)) / fact n"
proof -
  
  have c0: "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = ((n + 2) * (n + 1) * fact n - (n + 1) * fact n) / fact n"
    by (auto simp: fact.simps(2) algebra_simps)
  also have "((n + 2) * (n + 1) * fact n - (n + 1) * fact n) / fact n = ((n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1)) / 1"
    by (auto simp: algebra_simps)
  also have "((n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1)) / 1 = (n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1)"
    by (auto simp: algebra_simps)
  finally have c1: "(fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n = (n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1)" using c0 by auto

  
  have c2: "(n + 2) * (n + 1) - (n + 1) = ((n + 2) - 1) * (n + 1)"
    by (auto simp: algebra_simps)

  
  have c3: "((n + 2) - 1) * (n + 1) = (n + 1)^2"
    by (auto simp: algebra_simps)

  
  have "\<exists>x::nat. (real_of_nat x)^2 = (fact (n + 2) - fact (n + 1)) / fact n"
    using c3 h0 by (auto simp: fact.simps(2) algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

end

## Formal proof
```isabelle
theory induction_1pxpownlt1pnx
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma am_gm:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x >= 0" "y >= 0"
  shows "x^2 + y^2 >= 2*x*y"
proof -
  have "x^2 + y^2 = (x + y)^2 - 2*x*y" by sos
  also have "(x + y)^2 >= 0" using assms by simp
  finally have "x^2 + y^2 >= 2*x*y" by sos
  thus ?thesis .
qed


theorem induction_1pxpownlt1pnx:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + n*x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have "(1 + x)^(Suc n) = (1 + x)^n * (1 + x)" by simp
  also have "... > 0" using Suc.prems by (metis assms(1) mult.commute power_Suc real_0_less_add_iff zero_less_power)
  then have "(1 + n*x) + x * (1 + x)^n \<le> (1 + x)^n + x * (1 + x)^n" by (smt (verit) Suc)
  also have "... = (1 + x)^n + x * (1 + x)^n" by simp
  also have "... = (1 + x)^n * (1 + x)" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = (1 + x)^(Suc n)" by simp
  finally show ?case by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality assms(1) less_eq_real_def)
qed

end
```

Note: The above proof assumes that the base case for the induction is trivial (i.e., the statement is true for n = 0), and that the induction step can be proven using the properties of real numbers and the assumption that x > -1. The proof uses the fact that (1 + x)^n is always positive for n >= 0, and that (1 + x)^n * (1 + x) is equal to (1 + x)^(Suc n).

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_107
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma complete_square_x:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "(x + 4)^2 = x^2 + 8 * x + 16"
proof -
  have "(x + 4)^2 = (x + 4) * (x + 4)" by sos
  also have "... = x^2 + 8 * x + 16" by sos
  finally show ?thesis .
qed


lemma complete_square_y:
  fixes y :: real
  shows "(y - 3)^2 = y^2 - 6 * y + 9"
proof -
  have "(y - 3)^2 = (y - 3) * (y - 3)" by sos
  also have "... = y^2 - 6 * y + 9" by sos
  finally show ?thesis .
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_107:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x^2 + 8 * x + y^2 - 6 * y = 0" 
  shows "(x + 4)^2 + (y-3)^2 = 5^2"
proof -
  
  have "x^2 + 8 * x + y^2 - 6 * y = (x^2 + 8 * x + 16) + (y^2 - 6 * y + 9) - 16 - 9"
    by (simp add: complete_square_x complete_square_y algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 - 25" by sos
  finally have "(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 = 25" using assms by simp

  
  have "(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 = 5^2" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

This proof uses the `complete_square_x` and `complete_square_y` lemmas to complete the square for the $x$ and $y$ terms, respectively. The final step uses the fact that $(x + 4)^2 + (y - 3)^2 = 25$ to conclude that the radius of the circle is $\sqrt{25} = 5$.

  assumes "x + 4/100 * x = 598" 
  shows "x = 575"

  then have "x*(1+4/100) = 598" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x*(104/100) = 598" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x = 598*100/104" by auto
  then have "x = 575*25/25" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x = 575" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end

  by auto

  shows "a^2 mod 3 = 0 \<or> a^2 mod 3 = 1"
proof -
  obtain b::int where c0: "b = a mod 3" by (metis mod_mod_trivial)
  have c1: "b \<ge> 0 \<and> b \<le> 2" by (metis c0 mod_geq)
  hence c2: "a^2 mod 3 = b^2 mod 3" using c0 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis
  proof (cases "b=0")
    case True
    have "a^2 mod 3 = 0" using True c0 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
    then show ?thesis by simp
  next
    case c3: False
    then show ?thesis
    proof (cases "b=1")
      case True
      have "a^2 mod 3 = 1" using True c0
        by (simp add: algebra_simps)
      then show ?thesis by simp
    next
      case False
      have "b = 2" using c1 c3 False by (metis not_less_eq_eq)
      hence "a^2 mod 3 = 2^2 mod 3" using c2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
      also have "... = 1" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
      finally have "a^2 mod 3 = 1" by simp
      then show ?thesis by simp
    qed
  qed
qed

theory mathd_algebra_188
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares" "HOL-Library.Hilbert_Choice"
begin


lemma inverse_function_property:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij f"
  shows "f (Hilbert_Choice.inv f x) = x" "Hilbert_Choice.inv f (f x) = x"
proof -
  show "f (Hilbert_Choice.inv f x) = x"
    by (metis assms bij_inv_eq_iff)
  show "Hilbert_Choice.inv f (f x) = x"
    by (metis assms bij_inv_eq_iff)
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_188:
  fixes \<sigma>:: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij \<sigma>"
    and "\<sigma> 2 = (Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 2" 
  shows "\<sigma> (\<sigma> 2) = 2"
proof -
  
  have c0: "\<sigma> 2 = (Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 2" using assms(2)
    sledgehammer

  
  have c1: "\<sigma> (\<sigma> 2) = \<sigma> ((Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 2)" using c0
    sledgehammer

  
  have c2: "\<sigma> ((Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x) = x" by (metis inverse_function_property assms(1))

  
  have c3: "\<sigma> ((Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 2) = 2" using c2
    sledgehammer

  
  show ?thesis using c1 c3
    sledgehammer
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_246
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  
  have f3: "f 3 = a * 3^4 - b * 3^2 + 3 + 5"
    and f_minus3: "f (-3) = a * (-3)^4 - b * (-3)^2 + (-3) + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp+

  
  have "f 3 - f (-3) = (a * 3^4 - b * 3^2 + 3 + 5) - (a * (-3)^4 - b * (-3)^2 + (-3) + 5)"
    using f3 f_minus3 by simp

  
  then have "f 3 - f (-3) = a * 3^4 - a * (-3)^4 - b * 3^2 + b * (-3)^2 + 3 + 3 + 5 - 5"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "f 3 - f (-3) = a * (3^4 - (-3)^4) - b * (3^2 - (-3)^2) + 6"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  then have "f 3 - f (-3) = 6"
    by (simp add: power_even_abs power_odd_abs)
  then have "f 3 = f (-3) + 6"
    by (simp add: add.assoc)
  then have "f 3 = 2 + 6"
    using assms(2) by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

end
```
This proof follows the steps outlined in the informal proof and uses Isabelle's proof by simplification to arrive at the final result.

theory mathd_algebra_263
  imports Complex_Main
begin

lemma square_root_inequality:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "0 \<le> x" and "sqrt x = y"
  shows "y^2 = x"
proof -
  have "y^2 = (sqrt x)^2" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = x" using assms(1) by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma isolate_y:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "sqrt (19 + 3 * y) = 7"
  shows "3 * y = 30"
proof -
  have "19 + 3 * y = 7^2" using assms by (smt (verit) real_le_lsqrt real_sqrt_ge_0_iff real_sqrt_zero square_root_inequality zero_le_power2)
  then have "19 + 3 * y = 49" by simp
  then have "3 * y = 30" by (simp add: diff_add_inverse2)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_263:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "0 \<le> 19 + 3 * y"
    and "sqrt (19 + 3 * y) = 7" 
  shows "y = 10"
proof -
  have "3 * y = 30" using isolate_y assms by simp
  then have "y = 10" by (simp add: divide_pos_pos)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed
```

theory mathd_algebra_302
imports Complex_Main
begin


definition i :: complex where
  "i = \<i>"


theorem mathd_algebra_302:
  "(\<i> / 2)^2 = -(1 / 4)"
proof -
  
  have i_squared: "(\<i>)^2 = -1" by (simp add: i_def)

  
  have i_over_2_squared: "(\<i> / 2)^2 = (\<i>^2) / (4::complex)"
    by (simp add: power_divide)

  
  have i_over_2_squared_simplified: "(\<i> / 2)^2 = (-1) / (4::complex)"
    using i_over_2_squared i_squared by (simp add: divide_divide_eq)

  
  have result: "(\<i> / 2)^2 = -(1 / 4)"
    using i_over_2_squared_simplified by (simp add: divide_minus)

  show ?thesis using result .
qed

theory mathd_algebra_313
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_313:
  fixes v i z ::complex
  assumes "v = i * z"
    and "v = 1 + \<i>"
    and "z = 2 - \<i>"
  shows "i = 1/5 + 3/5 * \<i>"
proof -
  
  have c0: "v = i * z" using assms(1) sledgehammer

  
  have c1: "i = v / z" using c0 sledgehammer

  
  have c2: "z * (2 + \<i>) = (2 - \<i>) * (2 + \<i>)"
    using assms(3) sledgehammer
  also have "... = 4 + 2 * \<i> - 2 * \<i> - \<i>^2"
    using assms(3) sledgehammer
  also have "... = 4 + 1"
    using assms(3) sledgehammer
  also have "... = 5"
    sledgehammer
  finally have c3: "z * (2 + \<i>) = 5" using c2 sledgehammer

  
  have c4: "v * (2 + \<i>) = (1 + \<i>) * (2 + \<i>)"
    using assms(2) sledgehammer
  also have "... = 2 + 2 * \<i> + \<i> + \<i>^2"
    using assms(2) sledgehammer
  also have "... = 2 + 3 * \<i> - 1"
    using assms(2) sledgehammer
  also have "... = 1 + 3 * \<i>"
    sledgehammer
  finally have c5: "v * (2 + \<i>) = 1 + 3 * \<i>" using c4 sledgehammer

  
  have c6: "i = (1 + 3 * \<i>) / 5"
    using c1 c3 c5 sledgehammer
  also have "... = 1/5 + 3/5 * \<i>"
    sledgehammer
  finally have "i = 1/5 + 3/5 * \<i>" using c6 sledgehammer

  then show ?thesis
    sledgehammer
qed

theory mathd_algebra_314
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares"
begin


lemma power_2:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "2^(2*n) = (4::real)^n"
proof -
  have "2^(2*n) = (2::real)^ (2*n)" by (simp add: numeral_2_eq_2)
  also have "... = ((2::real)^2) ^ n" by (metis power_mult)
  also have "... = (4::real)^n" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by (metis Suc_1 \<open>2 ^ (2 * n) = 2\<^sup>2 ^ n\<close> \<open>2\<^sup>2 ^ n = 4 ^ n\<close> dbl_simps(3))
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_314:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n = 11" 
  shows "(1 / 4)^(n + 1) * 2^(2 * n) = 1 / (4::real)"
proof -
  
  have c0: "2^(2*n) = (4::real)^n" using power_2 by simp

  
  have c1: "(1 / 4)^(n + 1) * 2^(2 * n) = (1 / 4)^(n + 1) * (4::real)^n"
    using c0 by simp

  
  have c2: "(1 / 4)^(n + 1) * (4::real)^n = 1 / 4"
    by (simp add: power_divide)

  
  then show ?thesis using c2
    by simp
qed

end

## Formal Proof

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_33
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem mathd_algebra_33:
  fixes x y z :: real   
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0"
    and  "2 * x = 5 * y"
    and "7 * y = 10 * z"
  shows "z / x = 7 / 25"

proof -
  
  have "2 * x = 5 * y" by (simp add: assms(2))
  then have "y = (2/5) * x" by (simp add: divide_real_def)
  then have "y / x = 2/5" by (simp add: divide_real_def)

  
  have "7 * y = 10 * z" by (simp add: assms(3))
  then have "z = (7/10) * y" by (simp add: divide_real_def)
  then have "z / y = 7/10" by (simp add: divide_real_def)

  
  have "z / x = (z / y) * (y / x)" by (simp add: divide_real_def)
  also have "... = (7/10) * (2/5)" by (simp add: divide_real_def)
  also have "... = 14/50" by (simp add: divide_real_def)
  also have "... = 7/25" by (simp add: divide_real_def)
  finally have "z / x = 7/25" by (simp add: divide_real_def)

  show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_real_def)
qed

end
```

This proof shows that $\frac{z}{x}$ is equal to $\frac{7}{25}$, as required.

begin


lemma sum_of_equations:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25"
proof -
  have "(3 * a + b + c) + (a + 3 * b + c) + (a + b + 3 * c) = (-3) + 9 + 19"
    using assms by simp
  then have "3 * a + b + c + a + 3 * b + c + a + b + 3 * c = 25"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"

  shows "a * b * c = -56"

  hence g_6_eq: "g 6 = 7" by auto

imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_354:
  fixes a d :: real
  assumes "a + 6 * d = 30"
    and "a + 10 * d = 60" 
  shows "a + 20 * d = 135"
proof -
  
  

  
  

  
  have c0: "4 * d = 30" using assms(1) assms(2) sledgehammer

  
  hence "d = 15/2" using c0 sledgehammer

  
  have c1: "a + 20 * d = a + 10 * d + 10 * d" by simp
  have c2: "a + 20 * d = (a + 10 * d) + 10 * (15/2)" using c1 c0 assms(2) sledgehammer

  
  hence "a + 20 * d = 135" using c2 assms(2) sledgehammer
  then show ?thesis by (smt (verit) distrib_left of_int_mult of_int_numeral)
qed

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_359
imports Complex_Main 
begin


lemma mod_mult:
  fixes a b n :: nat
  shows "(a * b) mod n = ((a mod n) * (b mod n)) mod n"
proof -
  have "(a * b) mod n = (a mod n * b) mod n"
    by (metis mod_mult_left_eq)
  also have "... = ((a mod n) * (b mod n)) mod n"
    by (metis mod_mult_right_eq)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed


lemma linear_equation_solution:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "6 - y = y - 12"
  shows "y = 9"
proof -
  have "6 - y = y - 12" using assms by simp
  then have "6 + 12 = y + y" by (smt add_diff_cancel_left')
  then have "18 = 2 * y" by simp
  then have "y = 9" by (simp add: divide_pos_pos)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


lemma difference_between_terms:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b = a + d"
  shows "b - a = d"
proof -
  have "b - a = (a + d) - a" using assms by simp
  then have "b - a = a + d - a" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "b - a = d" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


lemma real_arithmetic:
  fixes a b c :: real
  shows "a + b - c = a + (b - c)"
proof -
  have "a + b - c = (a + b) - c"
    by (simp add: diff_diff_eq2)
  also have "... = a + (b - c)"
    by (simp add: diff_diff_eq)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_359:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "y + 6 + y = 2 * 12" 
  shows "y = 9"
proof -
  
  have "y + 6 + y = 2 * 12" using assms by simp
  
  then have "2 * y + 6 = 24" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  then have "2 * y = 18" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  then have "y = 9" by (simp add: divide_pos_pos)
  
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

theory mathd_algebra_388
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes x y z w :: real
  assumes "w = y - 3 * z"
  shows "3 * x + 4 * w = 3 * x + 4 * (y - 3 * z)"
proof -
  have "3 * x + 4 * w = 3 * x + 4 * (y - 3 * z)"
    using assms by simp
  thus ?thesis .
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_388:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + 4 * y - 12 * z = 10"
      and "-2 * x - 3 * y + 9 * z = -4"
  shows "x = 14"
proof -
  
  let ?w = "y - 3 * z"
  have "3 * x + 4 * ?w = 10" using assms(1) by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "-2 * x - 3 * ?w = -4" using assms(2) by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have "9 * x + 12 * ?w = 30" using `3 * x + 4 * ?w = 10` by simp
  have "-8 * x - 12 * ?w = -16" using `-2 * x - 3 * ?w = -4` by simp

  
  have "9 * x + 12 * ?w -8 * x - 12 * ?w = 30 - 16" using `9 * x + 12 * ?w = 30` ` -8 * x - 12 * ?w = -16` by simp
  hence "x = 14" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

end

theory mathd_algebra_432

begin


lemma expand_eq:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d"
  by (simp add: distrib_left distrib_right)


theorem mathd_algebra_432:
  fixes x :: real 
  shows "(x + 3) * (2 * x - 6) = 2 * x^2 - 18"
proof -

    by (smt (verit, best) distrib_left)
  also have "... = 2 * x * x + 3 * 2 * x - 6 * x - 18"
    by (smt (verit, best) distrib_left)

  
  also have "... = 2 * x^2 + 6 * x - 6 * x - 18"
    by (smt (verit, best) distrib_left)

  
  also have "... = 2 * x^2 - 18"
    by (smt (verit, best) distrib_left)

  
  finally show ?thesis
    by (smt (verit, best) distrib_left)
qed

end

imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_44:
  fixes s t :: real
  assumes "s = 9 - 2 * t"
    and "t = 3 * s + 1"
  shows "s = 1 \<and> t = 4"

  then have "t = 3 * (9 - 2 * t) + 1" by simp
  then have "t = 27 - 6 * t + 1" by simp
  then have "7 * t = 28" by simp
  then have "t = 4" by simp
  
  then have "s = 9 - 2 * 4" by (metis assms(1))
  then have "s = 1" by simp
  
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>t = 4\<close> assms(1) assms(2))
qed

end

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_513
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "c * a + d * b = e" and "c * a + d * b = f"
  shows "c * a + d * b = e - (e - f)"
proof -
  have "c * a + d * b = e" by fact
  then have "c * a + d * b = e - (e - f)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5"
    and "a + b = 2" 
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  
  have c0: "2 * a + 2 * b = 4"
    by (simp add: assms(2) algebra_simps)

  
  have c1: "3 * a - 2 * a = 5 - 4"
    using assms(1) c0 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have c2: "a = 1"
    by (simp add: diff_diff_eq2)

  
  have c3: "1 + b = 2"
    using c2 assms(2) by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have c4: "b = 1"
    by (simp add: diff_diff_eq2)

  
  have "a = 1" and "b = 1"
    using c2 c4 by (simp_all)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
