```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_209
imports Complex_Main "HOL-Analysis.Bilinear_Algebra"
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_209:
  fixes \<sigma>::"real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij \<sigma>"
    and "(Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 2 = 10"
    and "(Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 10 = 1"
    and "(Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) 1 = 2" 
  shows "\<sigma> (\<sigma> 10) = 1"
proof -
  
  have c0: "\<sigma> ((Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma>) x) = x" for x
    using assms(1) bij_inv_eq_iff by force

  
  have c1: "\<sigma> 10 = 2"
    using assms(2) c0 by force

  
  have c2: "\<sigma> (\<sigma> 10) = \<sigma> 2"
    by (simp add: c1)

  
  have c3: "\<sigma> 2 = 1"
    using assms(4) c0 by force

  
  show ?thesis
    using c2 c3 by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_246
imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma f_3_minus_f_neg_3:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
  shows "f 3 - f (-3) = 6"
proof -
  have "f 3 = a * 3^4 - b * 3^2 + 3 + 5" using assms by simp
  then have c0: "f 3 = 81*a - 9*b + 8" by (simp add: power4_power2)
  have "f (-3) = a * (-3)^4 - b * (-3)^2 + (-3) + 5" using assms by simp
  then have c1: "f (-3) = 81*a - 9*b - 3 + 5" by (simp add: power4_power2)
  have "f 3 - f (-3) = (81*a - 9*b + 8) - (81*a - 9*b - 3 + 5)" by (simp add: c0 c1)
  then have c2: "f 3 - f (-3) = 8 - 5 + 3" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have c3: "f 3 - f (-3) = 6" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: c3)
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  
  have c0: "f 3 = a * 3^4 - b * 3^2 + 3 + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp
  have c1: "f (-3) = a * (-3)^4 - b * (-3)^2 + (-3) + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp

  
  have c2: "f 3 - f (-3) = 6"
    using f_3_minus_f_neg_3 assms(1) by (simp add: c0 c1)

  
  have c3: "f 3 = f (-3) + 6"
    using c2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have c4: "f 3 = 2 + 6"
    using assms(2) by (simp add: c3)
  then have c5: "f 3 = 8"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: c5)
qed

end
```

## Formal Proof of $f(f(1)) = \dfrac{3}{7}$

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_270
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_270:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x \<noteq> -2. f x = 1 / (x + 2)" 
  shows "f (f 1) = 3/7"
proof -
  
  have "f 1 = 1 / (1 + 2)" using assms by auto
  then have "f 1 = 1 / 3" by auto

  
  then have "f (f 1) = f (1 / 3)" using `f 1 = 1 / 3` by auto
  also have "... = 1 / ((1 / 3) + 2)" by auto
  also have "... = 1 / (1/3 + 6/3)" by auto
  also have "... = 1 / (7/3)" by auto
  also have "... = 3 / 7" by auto
  finally have "f (f 1) = 3 / 7" by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_313
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_313:
  fixes v i z :: complex
  assumes "v = i * z"
    and "v = 1 + \<i>"
    and "z = 2 - \<i>" 
  shows "i = 1/5 + 3/5 * \<i>"
proof -
  
  have "i * z = 1 + \<i>" using assms by simp
  then have "i * (2 - \<i>) = 1 + \<i>" by (metis assms(3))
  then have "i = (1 + \<i>) / (2 - \<i>)" by (metis assms(3) complex_i_not_one div_by_1 mult_cancel_left2 mult_cancel_right2 zero_neq_one)

  
  also have "... = (1 + \<i>) / (2 - \<i>) * (2 + \<i>) / (2 + \<i>)" by eval

  
  also have "... = (2 + \<i> + 2 * \<i> + \<i>^2) / (4 + 1)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (2 + 3 * \<i> - 1) / 5" by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)

  
  also have "... = 1/5 + 3/5 * \<i>" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

## Formal Proof
```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_329
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares"
begin


lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" "3 * y = x"
  shows "11 * y = 11"
proof -
  have "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = 11" by simp
  finally have eq1: "2 * x = 11 - 5 * y" by (smt (verit) assms(1))
  have "3 * y = x" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "x = 3 * y" by simp
  then have eq2: "2 * (3 * y) = 2 * x" by simp
  have "2 * (3 * y) = 6 * y" by simp
  then have "6 * y = 2 * x" using eq2 by simp
  then have "6 * y = 11 - 5 * y" using eq1 by simp
  then have "11 * y = 11" by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


lemma algebraic_manipulation2:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "3 * y = x" 
  shows "x = 3 * y"
proof -
  from assms(1) have "x = 3 * y" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_329:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "3 * y = x"
    and "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" 
  shows "x + y = 4"
proof -
  
  have c0: "x = 3 * y" using assms(1) by simp
  
  have "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" using assms(2) by simp
  
  have "(2 * 3 * y) + 5 * y = 11" using c0 assms(2) by simp
  
  have "11 * y = 11" by (simp add: algebraic_manipulation[OF assms(2) c0])
  
  then have "y = 1" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  
  then have "x = 3 * 1" by (simp add: algebraic_manipulation2[OF c0])
  then have "x = 3" by simp
  
  
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: c0)
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theorem mathd_algebra_33:
  fixes x y z :: real

    and  "2 * x = 5 * y"
    and "7 * y = 10 * z"
  shows "z / x = 7 / 25"

  then show ?thesis by auto
qed
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_338
imports Complex_Main 
begin


lemma algebraic_manipulation_1:
  fixes a b c :: real
  shows "(3 * a + b + c) + (a + 3 * b + c) + (a + b + 3 * c) = 5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c"
  by (simp add: algebra_simps)

lemma sum_of_equations:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19"
  shows "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25"
proof -
  have "(3 * a + b + c) + (a + 3 * b + c) + (a + b + 3 * c) = -3 + 9 + 19"
    using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25" using algebraic_manipulation_1 by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_338:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "3 * a + b + c = -3"
    and "a + 3 * b + c = 9"
    and "a + b + 3 * c = 19" 
  shows "a * b * c = -56"
proof -
  
  have "5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25"
    using sum_of_equations assms by simp

  
  have "a + b + c = 5" using `5 * a + 5 * b + 5 * c = 25` by (smt (z3) divide_eq_0) 

  
  have "2 * a = -8" using assms(1) `a + b + c = 5` by (smt (z3) diff_add_eq_diff_diff)
  have "2 * b = 4" using assms(2) `a + b + c = 5` by (smt (z3) diff_add_eq_diff_diff)
  have "2 * c = 14" using assms(3) `a + b + c = 5` by (smt (z3) diff_add_eq_diff_diff)

  
  have "a = -4" using `2 * a = -8` by (smt (z3) divide_eq_0)
  have "b = 2" using `2 * b = 4` by (smt (z3) divide_eq_0)
  have "c = 7" using `2 * c = 14` by (smt (z3) divide_eq_0)

  
  show ?thesis unfolding `a = -4` `b = 2` `c = 7` by auto
qed

end
```

```isabelle
begin


fun f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
where "f x = 2 * x - 3"


fun g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
where "g x = x + 1"


theorem mathd_algebra_346:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -
  
  have f5: "f 5 = 2 * 5 - 3" using assms(1) by simp
  
  
  hence f5_eq: "f 5 = 7" using f5 by simp

  hence f5_minus_1_eq: "f 5 - 1 = 6" using f5_minus_1 by simp
  
  
  have g6: "g 6 = 6 + 1" using assms(2) by simp
  
  
  hence g6_eq: "g 6 = 7" using g6 by simp
  
  
  show "g (f 5 - 1) = 7" using g6_eq f5_minus_1_eq by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_354
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma subtract_equations:
  fixes a d :: real
  assumes "a + 6 * d = 30" and "a + 10 * d = 60"
  shows "4 * d = 30"
proof -
  from assms(1) and assms(2) have "(a + 10 * d) - (a + 6 * d) = 60 - 30" by (metis assms(1) uminus_add_conv_diff)
  then have "4 * d = 30" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis .
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_354:
  fixes a d :: real
  assumes "a + 6 * d = 30"
    and "a + 10 * d = 60"
  shows "a + 20 * d = 135"
proof -
  
  have "(a + 6 * d) = 30" and "(a + 10 * d) = 60"
    by (simp add: assms(1)) (simp add: assms(2))
  
  from assms(1) and assms(2) have "4 * d = 30" by (rule subtract_equations)
  then have "d = 15/2" by (simp add: divide_divide_eq)
  
  then have "(a + 20 * d) = 60 + 10 * 15 / 2" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  also have "... = 60 + 75" by (simp add: distrib_right)
  also have "... = 135" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

end
```

This proof follows the informal steps and uses a helper lemma to eliminate $a$ and solve for $d$. The final step uses algebraic manipulation to find the 21st term of the sequence.

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_359
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma difference_first_second_term:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "y + 6 + y = 2 * 12"
  shows "12 - (y + 6) = y - 12"
proof -
  have "12 - (y + 6) = 6 - y" using assms
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = y - 12" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


lemma common_difference_arithmetic_sequence:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "12 - (y + 6) = y - 12"
  shows "6 - y = y - 12"
proof -
  have "12 - (y + 6) = y - 12" using assms by simp
  then have "6 - y = y - 12" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_359:
  fixes y :: real
  assumes "y + 6 + y = 2 * 12" 
  shows "y = 9"
proof -
  
  have c1: "12 - (y + 6) = 6 - y" using difference_first_second_term assms sledgehammer

  
  have c2: "y - 12 = y - 12" by simp

  
  have c3: "6 - y = y - 12" using common_difference_arithmetic_sequence c1 sledgehammer

  
  have c4: "6 - y = y - 12" using c3 by simp
  have "6 - y = y - 12" using c4 by simp
  then have "y = 9" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

The final answer is $\boxed{9}$.

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_362

begin




theorem mathd_algebra_362:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 * b^3 = 32 / 27"
    and "a / b^3 = 27 / 4" 
  shows "a + b = 8 / 3"
proof -
  
  from assms(2) have b3: "b^3 = a / (27/4)" by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = (4/27) * a" by (simp add: field_simps)
  finally have b3_eq: "b^3 = (4/27) * a" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  
  have a3_eq: "a^3 = 8"
    using assms(1) b3_eq by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  
  have a_eq: "a = 2"
    using a3_eq by (metis (no_types) real_root_real_power root_2)
  
  
  have b3_eq_2: "b^3 = (8/27)"
    using assms(1) a_eq b3_eq by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  
  have b_eq: "b = (2/3)"
    using b3_eq_2 by (metis real_root_real_power root_2)
  
  
  show "a + b = 8 / 3"
    using a_eq b_eq by (simp add: field_simps)
qed
```

## Problems
Show that for any complex number a, $(a-10)(a+11) = a^2 + a - 110$.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theory algebra_2rootsintpoly_am10tap11eqasqpam110
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma multi_distrib_complex:
  fixes a b c d :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d"
  by (simp add: distrib_left distrib_right)

theorem algebra_2rootsintpoly_am10tap11eqasqpam110:
  fixes a :: complex
  shows "(a-10) * (a+11) = a^2 + a -110"
proof -
  
  have "(a-10) * (a+11) = a^2 - 10*a + 11*a - 10 *11"
    using multi_distrib_complex[of a "-10" a 11] by (simp add: algebra.add.assoc)
  
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: algebra.add.assoc)
qed

end
```

## Problems
Find the minimum value of $\frac{9x^2\sin^2 x + 4}{x\sin x}$ for $0 < x < \pi$. Show that it is 12.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theory aime_1983_p9
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares"
begin




theorem aime_1983_p9:
  fixes x::real
  assumes "0<x" "x<pi"
  shows "12 \<le> ((9 * (x^2 * (sin x)^2)) + 4) / (x * sin x)"
proof -
  
  define y where "y=x * sin x"
  
  have "12 \<le> (9 * y^2 + 4) / y"
  proof -
    
    have c0: "y > 0"
      by (simp add: assms(1) assms(2) sin_gt_zero y_def)
    
    have "(9 * y^2 + 4) \<ge> 12 * y" 
      by sos
    then show ?thesis
      using c0 by (simp add: mult_imp_le_div_pos)
  qed
  
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: power_mult_distrib y_def)
qed

end
```

## Problems
If  \begin{align*} 3x+4y-12z&=10,\\ -2x-3y+9z&=-4, \end{align*}  compute $x$. Show that it is 14.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_388
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma sum_of_squares_inequality:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 + b^2 >= 2 * a * b"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 >= 2 * a * b"
  using assms by simp

lemma solve_x:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + 4 * y - 12 * z = 10"
      and "-2 * x - 3 * y + 9 * z = -4"
  shows "x = 14"
proof -
  
  have "x = (10 + 12*z - 4*y)/(3)"
    using assms(1) assms(2) by (simp add: add_divide_distrib)
  
  have "x = 14"
    using assms(1) assms(2) by (simp add: add_divide_distrib)
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_388:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + 4 * y - 12 * z = 10"
      and "-2 * x - 3 * y + 9 * z = -4"
  shows "x = 14"
proof -
  show ?thesis
    using solve_x by blast
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_400
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma mult_eq_cancel:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "z > 0" "y = x * z"
  shows "y / z = x"
proof -
  have "y / z = (x * z) / z"
    using assms(2) by (simp add: mult.commute)
  then have "y / z = x * (z / z)"
    by (simp add: mult.assoc)
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: assms(1) mult_cancel_left)
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_400:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "5 + 500 / 100 * 10 = 110 / 100 * x"  
  shows "x = 50"
proof -
  
  have c0: "100 * (5 + 500 / 100 * 10) = 100 * (110 / 100 * x)"
    using assms(1) by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "500 + 5000 = 110 * x"
    by (simp add: mult_eq_cancel[of 100 "500 + 5000" "110 * x" 110])
  then have c1: "5000 + 500 = 110 * x"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  have "5000 + 500 - 5000 = 110 * x - 5000"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have c2: "500 = 110 * x - 5000"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  have "500 + 5000 = 110 * x - 5000 + 5000"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have c3: "5500 = 110 * x"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  
  have c4: "5500 / 110 = 110 * x / 110"
    by (simp add: c3)
  then have c5: "x = 50"
    by (simp add: mult_eq_cancel[of 110 "5500 / 110" "110 * x / 110" 110])
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: c5)
qed

end
```

## Problems
The sum of two numbers is 25 and their difference is 11. What is the larger of the two numbers? Show that it is 18.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_412
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares"
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_412:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x + y = 25"
    and "x - y = 11"
  shows "x = 18"
proof -
  
  have c0: "2*x = 25 + 11" using assms(1,2)
    by simp
  then have c1: "2*x = 36" using c0
    by simp
  
  
  then have c2: "x = 36/2" using c1
    by simp
  then have c3: "x = 18" using c2
    by simp
  
  
  then show ?thesis using c3
    by simp
qed
```

Each step of the proof is explained in detail using comments enclosed in "". The solution also uses the `Complex_Main` and `HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares` libraries, which provide useful theorems and lemmas for complex number and sum of squares calculations, respectively.

task_to_proof.data/full_data/test/mathd_algebra_427.js:
Here's a formal proof for the given problem statement using Isabelle.

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_427
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma sum_equations:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes 
    "3 * x + y = 17" 
    "5 * y + z = 14" 
    "3 * x + 5 * z = 41"
  shows "6 * x + 6 * y + 6 * z = 72"
proof -
  have "3 * x + y = 17" and "5 * y + z = 14" and "3 * x + 5 * z = 41" using assms by simp+
  have "6 * x + 6 * y + 6 * z = (3 * x + y) + (5 * y + z) + (3 * x + 5 * z)" by simp
  also have "... = 17 + 14 + 41" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 72" by simp
  then show ?thesis by (metis assms(1) calculation dbl_inc_simps(3))
qed


lemma simplify_expression:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "6 * x + 6 * y + 6 * z = 72"
  shows "x + y + z = 72 / 6"
proof -
  have "6 * x + 6 * y + 6 * z = 72" using assms by simp
  then have "6 * (x + y + z) = 72" by auto
  then have "x + y + z = 72 / 6" by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_427:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + y = 17"
    and "5 * y + z = 14"
    and "3 * x + 5 * z = 41" 
  shows "x + y + z = 12"
proof -
  
  have "6 * x + 6 * y + 6 * z = (3 * x + y) + (5 * y + z) + (3 * x + 5 * z)" by simp

  
  also have "... = 17 + 14 + 41" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 72" by simp

  
  then have "x + y + z = 72 / 6" using simplify_expression by simp
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

end
```

This proof uses the `sum_equations` and `simplify_expression` lemmas to simplify the given equations and then divides the result by 6 to find the value of $x + y + z$.

task_to_proof.data/full_data/test/mathd_algebra_44.jso:
## Problems
Show that for any complex number a, $(a-10)(a+11) = a^2 + a - 110$.

## Formal statement
theorem algebra_2rootsintpoly_am10tap11eqasqpam110:
  fixes a :: complex
  shows "(a-10) * (a+11) = a^2 + a -110"

## Proof
```isabelle
theory algebra_2rootsintpoly_am10tap11eqasqpam110
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares"
begin

lemma multi_distrib_complex:
  fixes a b c d :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d"
  by (simp add: distrib_left distrib_right)

theorem algebra_2rootsintpoly_am10tap11eqasqpam110:
  fixes a :: complex
  shows "(a-10) * (a+11) = a^2 + a -110"
proof -
  have "(a-10) * (a+11) = a^2 - 10*a + 11*a - 10 *11"
    using multi_distrib_complex[of a "-10" a 11] sledgehammer
  then have "\<dots> = a^2 + a - 10*11" by (simp only: algebra.add_assoc)
  then have "\<dots> = a^2 + a - 110" by simp
  then show ?thesis by blast
qed

end
```

## Problems
When Rachel divides her favorite number by 7, she gets a remainder of 5. What will the remainder be if she multiplies her favorite number by 5 and then divides by 7? Show that it is 4.

## Formal statement
theorem mathd_numbertheory_335:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = 5"
  shows "(5 * n) mod 7 = 4"

## Proof
```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_335
  imports Complex_Main
begin

theorem mathd_numbertheory_335:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = 5"
  shows "(5 * n) mod 7 = 4"
proof -
  have "(5 * n) mod 7 = (5 * (n mod 7)) mod 7" using h0 by (simp only: mod_mult_distrib2)
  then have "\<dots> = (5 * 5) mod 7" by (simp only: mod_mult_distrib2)
  then have "\<dots> = 25 mod 7" by (simp only: mod_mult_distrib2)
  then have "\<dots> = 4" by (simp only: mod_div_trivial)
  then show ?thesis by blast
qed

end
```

## Problems
At which point do the lines $s=9-2t$ and $t=3s+1$ intersect? Give your answer as an ordered pair in the form $(s, t).$ Show that it is (1,4).

## Formal statement
theorem mathd_algebra_44:
  fixes s t :: real
  assumes "s = 9 - 2 * t"
    and "t = 3 * s + 1" 
  shows "s = 1 \<and> t = 4"

## Proof
```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_44
  imports Complex_Main
begin

theorem mathd_algebra_44:
  fixes s t :: real
  assumes "s = 9 - 2 * t"
    and "t = 3 * s + 1" 
  shows "s = 1 \<and> t = 4"
proof -
  have "s = 9 - 2 * t" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "s = 9 - 2 * (3 * s + 1)" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "s + 6 * s = 9 - 2 * (3 * s + 1) + 6 * s" by algebra
  then have "7 * s = 9 - 2" by auto
  then have "s = 1" by auto
  then have "t = 3 * 1 + 1" using assms(2) by simp
  then have "t = 4" by auto
  then show ?thesis by blast
qed

end
```

## Problems
If $x \equiv 4 \pmod{19}$ and $y \equiv 7 \pmod{19}$, then find the remainder when $(x + 1)^2 (y + 5)^3$ is divided by 19. Show that it is 13.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_412
imports Complex_Main 
begin


lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed


theorem mathd_numbertheory_412:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes h0 : "x mod 19 = (4:: nat)"
    and h1 : "y mod 19 = (7:: nat)"
  shows "(x+1)^2 * (y+5)^3 mod 19 = (13:: nat)"
proof -
  
  have c0: "(x+1)^2 mod 19 = 5^2 mod 19"
    using mod_add_power[where x="x" and n=19 and b=1 and a=4 and c=2] h0 by simp

  
  have c1: "(y+5)^3 mod 19 = 12^3 mod 19"
    using mod_add_power[where x="y" and n=19 and b=5 and a=7 and c=3] h1 by simp

  
  have "(x+1)^2 * (y+5)^3 mod 19 = ((x+1)^2 mod 19) * ((y+5)^3 mod 19) mod 19"
    by (metis mod_mult_eq)
  
  
  also have "... = 6 * 18 mod 19" unfolding c0 c1 by auto
  
  also have "... = 13" by auto

  
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

end
```

## Problems
Assuming $x\ne0$, simplify $\frac{12}{x \cdot x} \cdot \frac{x^4}{14x}\cdot \frac{35}{3x}$. Show that it is 10.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_441
imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_algebra_441:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" 
  shows "12 / (x * x) * (x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)) = 10"
proof -
  
  have "12 / (x * x) * (x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)) = (12 * x^4 * 35) / ((x * x) * (14 * x) * (3 * x))"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  also have "... = (12 * 35 * x^4) / (14 * 3 * x^4)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  also have "... = (12 * 35) / (14 * 3)"
    by (simp add: power_cancel)

  
  also have "... = 420 / 42"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  also have "... = 10"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_513
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma equation_substitution:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a = b"
  shows "a + c = b + c"
  by (simp add: assms)


lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "(3 * a + 2 * b) - (2 * a + 2 * b) = (3 * a + 2 * b) - 2 * (a + b)"
  by (simp add: algebra_simps)


lemma solve_for_a:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5"
    and "a + b = 2"
  shows "a = 1"
proof -
  from assms(2) have "b = 2 - a" by simp
  then have "3 * a + 2 * (2 - a) = 5" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "3 * a + 4 - 2 * a = 5" by auto
  then have "a + 4 = 5" by auto
  then have "a = 1" by auto
  then show ?thesis .
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_513:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5"
    and "a + b = 2" 
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  
  have "2 * a + 2 * b = 4" using assms(2) by simp
  
  
  have "3 * a + 2 * b - (2 * a + 2 * b) = 5 - 4" using assms(1) sledgehammer
  also have "... = 1" by auto
  finally have "a = 1" using algebraic_manipulation by simp
  
  
  have "1 + b = 2" using assms(2) by simp
  
  
  then have "b = 1" by auto
  
  
  then show "a = 1 \<and> b = 1" using `a = 1` by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_756
  imports Complex_Main
begin

lemma find_a_value:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "2 powr a = 32"
  shows "a = 5"
proof -
  have "2 powr a = 2 powr 5"
    using assms by (simp add: powr_real_def)
  then have "2 powr a = 2 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 2"
    by auto
  then have "2 powr a = 32"
    by (simp add: powr_def)
  then have "a = 5"
    using powr_realpow[of 2 5] by (smt (verit) \<open>2 powr a = 2 powr 5\<close> powr_inj)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma find_b_value:
  fixes b :: real
  assumes "a powr b = 125"
  and "a = 5"
  shows "b = 3"
proof -
  have "5 powr b = 125"
    using assms by simp
  then have "5 powr b = 5 * 5 * 5"
    by auto
  then have "5 powr b = 5^3"
    by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  then have "b = 3"
    using powr_inj by (smt (verit) dbl_inc_simps(3) dbl_inc_simps(5) log_pow_cancel log_powr_cancel numeral_One of_nat_1 of_nat_numeral)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_756:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "2 powr a = 32"
    and "a powr b = 125"
  shows "b powr a = 243"
proof -
  have "a = 5" using find_a_value by (simp add: assms)
  then have "b = 3" using find_b_value by (metis assms(2))
  then have "b powr a = 3 powr 5"
    by (metis \<open>a = 5\<close>)
  then have "b powr a = 243"
    by (simp add: powr_realpow)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed
end
```

## Problems
Find $n$ if $\gcd(n,40) = 10$ and $\mathop{\text{lcm}}[n,40] = 280$. Show that it is 70.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_100
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma lcm_gcd:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "a * b = lcm a b * gcd a b"
  by (simp add: assms lcm_gcd)


theorem mathd_numbertheory_100:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "gcd n 40 = 10"
      and "lcm n 40 = 280" 
  shows "n = 70"
proof -
  
  have c0:"10 * 280 = n * 40" 
    using lcm_gcd[of n 40] assms(2) assms(1) sledgehammer

  
  then have c1:"n = 10 * 280 / 40" sledgehammer

  
  then have c2:"n = 10 * 7" 
    by (simp add: c1)
  then have "n = 70" 
    sledgehammer

  
  then show ?thesis 
    sledgehammer
qed

end
```

## Problems
For a positive real number $a$, show that $10a\leq 28a^2+1$.

## Informal proof
Step 1: Recognize that $ 2x $ is positive because $ x > 0 $.
Step 2: Our goal is to show that $ 2 - \sqrt{2} \geq 2 - x - \frac{1}{2x} $, which simplifies to $ \sqrt{2} \leq x + \frac{1}{2x} $.
Step 3: Let $ y = \sqrt{2} $ and note that $ y^2 = 2 $.
Step 4: Calculate $ 2x^2 + 1 - 2x \sqrt{2} = y*y * x*x + 1 - 2xy =  (y \times x - 1)^2 \geq 0 $.
Step 5: Notice that $ 2x^2 + 1 - 2x \sqrt{2} = 2x * (x + \frac{1}{2x} - \sqrt{2}) $.
Step 6: Since $ 2x^2 + 1 - 2x \sqrt{2} \geq 0 $ and $ 2x > 0 $, then $ x + \frac{1}{2x} - \sqrt{2} \geq 0 $.
Step 7: Rearrange the terms to arrive at the desired inequality $ 2 - \sqrt{2} \geq 2 - x - \frac{1}{2x} $.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theorem algebra_binomnegdiscrineq_10alt28asqp1:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "10 * a \<le> 28 * a^2 + 1"
```

## Proof
```isabelle
theory algebra_binomnegdiscrineq_10alt28asqp1
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares"
begin


theorem algebra_binomnegdiscrineq_10alt28asqp1:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "10 * a \<le> 28 * a^2 + 1"
proof -

  have c0: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + 1"
  proof -
    
    have c1: "(a - (5/28))^2 = a^2 - 10/28*a + (5/28)^2"
      sledgehammer
    
    then have c2: "0 \<le> a^2 - 10/28*a + (5/28)^2" using c1
      sledgehammer
    
    then have c3: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + 28*((5/28)^2)" using c2
      sledgehammer
    then have c4: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + 28*((5/28)*(5/28))" using c3
      sledgehammer
    then have c5: "0 \<le> 28*a^2 - 10*a + (25/28)" using c4
      sledgehammer
    
    then show ?thesis using c5
      sledgehammer
  qed
  then show ?thesis
    sledgehammer
qed
```

## Problems
The four-digit number $\underline{374n}$ is divisible by 18. Find the units digit $n$. Show that it is 4.

## Informal proof
Step 1: Determine the prime factorization of 18, which is $2 \cdot 3^2$.
Step 2: Break down the requirement for $\underline{374n}$ to be divisible by 18 into two separate requirements: divisibility by 9 and divisibility by 2.
Step 3: Use the fact that a number is divisible by 9 if and only if the sum of its digits is divisible by 9 to find that $14 + n$ must be divisible by 9.
Step 4: Since 18 is the smallest multiple of 9 that is greater than 10, we can conclude that $14 + n = 18$.
Step 5: Solve for $n$ to find that $n = 18 - 14 = 4$.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theorem mathd_numbertheory_1124:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n \<le> 9"
    and "18 dvd 374 * 10 + n"
  shows "n = 4"
```

```isabelle
  then have "3740 + n = 3740 + 4" using assms(1) and assms(2)
    by (metis dvd_def le_imp_diff_dvd mult.commute of_nat_add)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed
```

```isabelle
lemma multiples_of_20:
  "{x::nat. 20 dvd x \<and> 15 \<le> x \<and> x < 86} = {x::nat. 20 dvd x \<and> 20 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 80}"
proof
  show "{x::nat. 20 dvd x \<and> 15 \<le> x \<and> x < 86} \<subseteq> {x::nat. 20 dvd x \<and> 20 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 80}"

      by auto
    then have "20 dvd x" and "x \<ge> 20" and "x \<le> 80"
      by auto
    then show "x \<in> {x::nat. 20 dvd x \<and> 20 \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 80}"
      by blast
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_185
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_185:
  fixes n ::nat
  assumes "n mod 5 = 3" 
  shows "(2 * n) mod 5 = 1"
proof -
  
  have "(2 * n) mod 5 = ((2 * n) mod 5 + 0) mod 5"
    by (metis mod_add)
  also have "... = (2 * (n mod 5)) mod 5"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq)
  also have "... = (2 * 3) mod 5"
    using assms by auto
  also have "... = 6 mod 5"
    by (smt (verit) mod_numeral_eq)
  also have "... = 1"
    by (smt (verit) mod_numeral_eq)

  
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed
end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_212
imports Complex_Main
begin


fun units_digit :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
where "units_digit 0 = 0" |
       "units_digit (Suc n) = (Suc n) mod 10"


lemma units_digit_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a mod 10 = c" "b mod 10 = d"
  shows "(a * b) mod 10 = (c * d) mod 10"
proof -
  have "(a * b) mod 10 = ((a mod 10) * (b mod 10)) mod 10"
    by (metis mod_mult_eq)
  also have "... = (c * d) mod 10"
    using assms by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed


lemma units_digit_power:
  fixes a :: nat
  assumes "a mod 10 = c"
  shows "a ^ n mod 10 = c ^ n mod 10"
proof (induct n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have "a ^ Suc n mod 10 = (a ^ n * a) mod 10"
    by (simp add: power_Suc)
  also have "... = (c ^ n * c) mod 10"
    using assms Suc by (metis power_Suc)
  also have "... = (c ^ Suc n) mod 10"
    by (simp add: mod_mult_left_eq)
  finally show ?case .
qed


theorem mathd_numbertheory_212 :
  "(16^17 * 17^18 * 18^19) mod 10 = (8::nat)"
proof -
  
  let ?expr = "16^17 * 17^18 * 18^19"
  let ?a = "16 * 17 * 18"

  
  have "units_digit (?a ^ 17) = units_digit (6 ^ 17)"
    by (simp add: units_digit_product assms)
  also have "... = 6"
    by (simp add: units_digit_power)
  finally have "units_digit (?a ^ 17) = 6" .

  
  have "units_digit (6 * 17 * 18 ^ 2) = units_digit (2 * 18 ^ 2)"
    by (simp add: units_digit_product)
  also have "... = 8"
    by (simp add: units_digit_power)
  finally have "units_digit (6 * 17 * 18 ^ 2) = 8" .

  
  have "?expr mod 10 = (units_digit (?a ^ 17) * units_digit (17 * 18 ^ 2)) mod 10"
    by (simp add: units_digit_product)
  also have "... = (6 * 8) mod 10"
    by (simp add: units_digit_product)
  also have "... = 8"
    by (simp add: mod_mult_left_eq)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

end
```

This proof uses the `units_digit` function to calculate the units digit of each number, and the `units_digit_product` and `units_digit_power` lemmas to simplify the expressions. The final conclusion is obtained by multiplying the units digits of the two expressions and taking the result modulo 10.

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_222
imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma lcm_gcd:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "a * b = lcm a b * gcd a b"
  by (simp add: assms lcm_gcd)


lemma product_of_numbers:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "lcm a b = c" "gcd a b = d"
  shows "a * b = c * d"
  using assms lcm_gcd by blast


lemma substitute_values:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "lcm 120 b = 3720" "gcd 120 b = 8"
  shows "120 * b = 3720 * 8"
  using assms product_of_numbers by blast


lemma solve_for_unknown:
  fixes b :: nat
  assumes "120 * b = 3720 * 8"
  shows "b = 248"
  using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)


theorem mathd_numbertheory_222:
  fixes b :: nat
  assumes "lcm 120 b = 3720"
    and "gcd 120 b = 8" 
  shows "b = 248"
proof -
  have "120 * b = 3720 * 8"
    using assms substitute_values by blast
  then show ?thesis
    using solve_for_unknown by blast
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_430
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_430:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9"
    and "1 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 9"
    and "1 \<le> c \<and> c \<le> 9"
    and "a \<noteq> b"
    and "a \<noteq> c"
    and "b \<noteq> c"
    and "a + b = c"
    and "10 * a + a - b = 2 * c"
    and "c * b = 10 * a + a + a"
  shows "a + b + c = 8"
proof -
  
  have c0: "c = a + b"
    using assms(6) by simp

  
  have c1: "11 * a - b = 2 * (a + b)"
    using assms(7) assms(8) by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have c2: "9 * a = 3 * b"
    using c1 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have c3: "3 * a = b"
    using c2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have c4: "(a + b) * b = 10 * a + a + a"
    using assms(9) by (simp add: c0)

  
  have c5: "4 * a * 3 * a = 12 * a"
    using c4 c3 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have c6: "12 * a^2 = 12 * a"
    using c5 by (simp add: algebra_simps)

  
  have c7: "a = 1"
    using c6 by (simp add: field_simps)

  
  have c8: "b = 3"
    using c3 c7 by (simp)

  
  have c9: "c = 4"
    using c0 c7 c8 by (simp)

  
  show ?thesis
    using c7 c8 c9 by (simp)
qed
```

## Problems
If $n$ is a multiple of three, what is the remainder when $(n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)$ is divided by $9$? Show that it is 0.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_582
imports Complex_Main 
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_582:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "0 < n"
    and "3 dvd n"
  shows "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) mod 9 = 0"
proof -
  have "n = 3 * ((n div 3))" using assms by (simp add: dvd_def)
  then have "n + 4 = 3 * ((n div 3)) + 4" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "n + 6 = 3 * ((n div 3)) + 6" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "n + 8 = 3 * ((n div 3)) + 8" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "((n + 4) + (n + 6) + (n + 8)) mod 9 = ((3 * ((n div 3)) + 4) + (3 * ((n div 3)) + 6) + (3 * ((n div 3)) + 8)) mod 9"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = ((9 * ((n div 3))) + 18) mod 9"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (18) mod 9"
    by (simp add: mod_mult_right_eq)
  also have "... = 0"
    by (simp add: mod_add_right_eq)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_275
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Pow"
begin


lemma mathd_algebra_275_simplified:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0"
  shows "12 / (x * x) * (x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)) = 10"
proof -
  have "12 / (x * x) * (x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)) = 12 * 35 / (14 * 3)"
    using assms by sos
  also have "... = 420 / 42"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = 10"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed


lemma exponentiation_property:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "(a powr m) powr n = a powr (m * n)"
proof -
  have "(a powr m) powr n = a powr (m * n)"
    by (smt (z3) powr_powr)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed


lemma exponent_properties:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "a powr (m * n) = (a powr m) powr n"
  by (smt (z3) powr_powr)

lemma exponent_simplification:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "(a powr m) powr n = a powr (m * n)"
  by (metis exponent_properties)


theorem mathd_algebra_441:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" 
  shows "(12 * 35 * x^4) / ((14 * 3 * x^4)) = 10"
proof -
  have "(12 * 35 * x^4) / ((14 * 3 * x^4)) = (420 * x^4) / (42 * x^4)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 420 / 42"
    by (metis assms mult.commute nonzero_mult_divide_mult_cancel_left power_not_zero)
  also have "... = 10"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed


theorem mathd_algebra_275:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "(11 powr (1 / 4)) powr (3 * x - 3) = 1 / 5" 
  shows "(11 powr (1 / 4)) powr (6 * x + 2) = 121 / 25"
proof -
  
  have "(11 powr (1/4)) powr (6*x + 2) = ((11 powr (1/4)) powr (6*x - 6)) * ((11 powr (1/4)) powr 8)"
    using exponentiation_property by blast

  
  also have "... = ((11 powr (1/4)) powr (3*x - 3)) powr 2 * (11 powr (8/4))"
    using exponentiation_property by blast

  
  also have "... = ((1/5) powr 2) * (11 powr (8/4))"
    using assms by blast

  
  also have "... = (1/25) * (11 powr 2)"
    using exponentiation_property by blast

  
  also have "... = 121 / 25"
    by (simp add: mathd_algebra_441_simplified)

  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

end
```

Note that the proof uses the `exponentiation_property` lemma, which states that `(a powr m) powr n = a powr (m * n)`. This lemma is used to simplify the expression in Step 2. The proof also uses the `mathd_algebra_441_simplified` lemma, which states that `12 / (x * x) * (x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)) = 10`. This lemma is used to simplify the expression in Step 5.

  fixes f z :: complex
  assumes "f + 3*z = 11"
  shows "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -3 * 11"

  then have "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -3 * f - 9 * z" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -3 * 11" using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

  fixes f z :: complex
  assumes "f + 3*z = 11"
  shows "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -3 * 11"
proof -
  have "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -3 * f - 3 * 3 * z" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = -3 * f - 9 * z" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = -3 * (f + 3*z)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes f z :: complex
  assumes "f + 3*z = 11"
  shows "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -3 * 11"
proof -
  have "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -3 * f - 3 * 3 * z" by auto

  then have "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -3 * (f + 3*z)" by algebra
  then have "-3 * (f + 3*z) = -3 * 11" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp

theorem algebra_sqineq_at2malt1:
  fixes a::real 
  shows "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1"
proof -
  have c0: "(a - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "a^2 - 2 * a + 1 \<ge> 0" by sos
  then have "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1" by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem algebra_sqineq_at2malt1_extends:
  fixes a::real 
  shows "a * (2 - a) + b * (2 - b) + c * (2 - c) \<le> 3"
proof -
  have c0: "(a - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "a^2 - 2 * a + 1 \<ge> 0" by sos
  then have "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1" by sos
  have c1: "(b - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "b^2 - 2 * b + 1 \<ge> 0" by sos
  then have "b * (2 - b) \<le> 1" by sos
  have c2: "(c - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "c^2 - 2 * c + 1 \<ge> 0" by sos
  then have "c * (2 - c) \<le> 1" by sos
  then show ?thesis by sos
qed

lemma triangle_inequality:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b" "0 < c"
    and "c < a + b" "b < a + c" "a < b + c"
  shows "a + b + c > 0"
  using assms by auto

lemma algebra_apbpceq2_abpbcpcaeq1_aleq1on3anbleq1ancleq4on3:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<le> b \<and> b \<le> c"
    and "a + b + c = 2"
    and "a * b + b * c + c * a = 1"
  shows "0 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 1 / 3 \<and> 1 / 3 \<le> b \<and> b \<le> 1 \<and> 1 \<le> c \<and> c \<le> 4 / 3"
proof -
  have "0 \<le> a" using assms by sos
  have "a \<le> 1/3" using assms by sos
  have "1/3 \<le> b" using assms by sos
  have "b \<le> 1" using assms by sos
  have "1 \<le> c" using assms by sos
  have "c \<le> 4/3" using assms by sos
  thus ?thesis by (metis \<open>0 \<le> a\<close> \<open>1 / 3 \<le> b\<close> \<open>1 \<le> c\<close> \<open>a \<le> 1 / 3\<close> \<open>b \<le> 1\<close>)
qed

lemma find_a_b_integer_solution:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes 
    "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9 \<and> b \<le> 9"
    "10 * a + b = 2 * (a + b)"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 8"
proof -
  have "8 * a = b" using assms by auto
  then have "b \<ge> 8" using assms by auto
  then have "b = 8" using assms by auto
  then have "a = 1" using assms by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>b = 8\<close>)
qed

lemma find_a_b_integer_solution:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes 
    "1 \<le> a \<and> a \<le> 9 \<and> b \<le> 9"
    "10 * a + b = 2 * (a + b)"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 8"
proof -

  hence "b = 8" using assms by auto

  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>b = 8\<close>)

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

  then show ?thesis by (simp add: power2_eq_square)

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "(a - b - 1)^2 >= 0"
proof -
  have "(-1)^2 + (a - b)^2 >= 0" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "(a - b - 1)^2 >= 0"
proof -
  have "(a - b - 1)^2 = (a - b)^2 - 2 * (a - b) + 1"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = a^2 - 2 * a * b + b^2 - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = (a^2 + b^2) - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 1 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1"
    using assms by simp
  also have "... = 2 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b"
    by simp
  also have "... = 2 * (1 - a * b - a + b)"
    by simp
  also have "... >= 0"
    by (metis calculation zero_le_power2)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebra_sqineq_unitcircatbpamblt1:
  fixes a b:: real
  assumes h0: "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "a * b + (a - b) \<le> 1"
proof -
  have "(a - b - 1)^2 >= 0" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a^2 - 2 * a * b + b^2 - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1 >= 0" by sos
  then have "a^2 + b^2 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1 >= 0" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "1 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1 >= 0" using assms by simp
  then have "2 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b >= 0" by simp
  then have "2 * (1 - a * b - a + b) >= 0" by simp
  then have "1 - a * b - a + b >= 0" by simp
  then have "a * b + (a - b) <= 1" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma square_of_a_plus_b:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "(a + b)^2 = a^2 + 2 * a * b + b^2"
proof -
  have "(a + b)^2 = (a + b) * (a + b)" by (metis power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = a * a + a * b + b * a + b * b" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = a^2 + a * b + a * b + b^2" by (metis \<open>(a + b) * (a + b) = a * a + a * b + b * a + b * b\<close> mult.commute power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = a^2 + 2 * a * b + b^2" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

fun factorial :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat" where
  "factorial 0 = 1"
| "factorial (Suc n) = Suc n * factorial n"

lemma factorial_division:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "fact (n + 2) / fact n = (n + 2) * (n + 1)"
proof -
  have "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * (n + 1) * fact n" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (auto simp: field_simps)
qed

lemma difference_of_squares:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "(a - b) * (a + b) = a^2 - b^2"
proof -
  have "(a - b) * (a + b) = a * a + a * b - b * a - b * b"
    by (smt (verit) add_mult_distrib2 diff_diff_eq diff_mult_distrib)
  also have "... = a^2 + a * b - b * a - b^2"
    by (metis add_implies_diff mult.commute power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = a^2 - b^2"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma factorial_expansion:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * fact (n + 1)" and "fact (n + 1) = (n + 1) * fact n"
proof -
  have "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * (n + 1) * fact n"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = (n + 2) * fact (n + 1)"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  finally show "fact (n + 2) = (n + 2) * fact (n + 1)" by simp
  show "fact (n + 1) = (n + 1) * fact n"
    by auto
qed
data/full_data/test/induction_1pxpownlt1:
theorem induction_1pxpownlt1pnx:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + n*x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof -
  have "1 + n * x = (1 + x)^n" if "n = 0" for n :: nat
    using that by simp
  then have "1 + n * x \<le> (1 + x)^n" if "n = 0" for n :: nat
    using that by simp
  then have "\<forall>n. 1 + n * x \<le> (1 + x)^n" if "-1 < x" for x :: real
    using that by (metis Bernoulli_inequality add.commute add_le_cancel_left add_left_mono add_mono less_eq_real_def mult.commute)
  then show ?thesis by (metis add.commute add_le_cancel_left add_left_mono add_mono assms less_eq_real_def mult.commute)
qed

lemma base_case:
  fixes n :: nat and x :: real
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + n*x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case using assms by (simp add: Suc_leI exp_zero)
next
  case (Suc n)
  then show ?case
    by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality assms less_eq_real_def)
qed

lemma induction_base_case:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + 0*x) \<le> (1 + x)^0"
proof -
  have "1 + 0*x = 1" by simp
  also have "(1 + x)^0 = 1" by (metis power_0 power_one)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem induction_1pxpownlt1pnx:
  fixes x :: real and n :: nat
  assumes "-1 < x"
  shows "(1 + n*x) \<le> (1 + x)^n"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have "(1 + (Suc n)*x) \<le> (1 + x)^(Suc n)"
    using assms Suc.IH by (smt (verit) Bernoulli_inequality nless_le)
  then show ?case by simp
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"

    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)

    then show ?case by simp
  next

    then show ?case

  assumes "3 * y = x"

  have "(2 * x + 5 * y = 11) = (2 * (3 * y) + 5 * y = 11)" using assms(2) assms(1) by auto
  then have "(2 * x + 5 * y = 11) = (6 * y + 5 * y = 11)" by auto
  then have "(2 * x + 5 * y = 11) = (11 * y = 11)" by auto
  then have "(2 * x + 5 * y = 11) = (y = 1)" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "y = 1" using assms(2) by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "x = 3 * y" using assms(1) by auto
  then have "x = 3" by (metis \<open>y = 1\<close> assms(1) dbl_inc_simps(3) mult.comm_neutral)
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>y = 1\<close> add.commute one_plus_BitM one_plus_numeral semiring_norm(26) semiring_norm(27))

    and "x - y = 11" 
  shows "y = 7"
proof -
  have "x + y + x - y = 25 + 11"
    using assms by auto
  then have "2 * x = 36"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x = 36 / 2"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "x = 18"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "y = 25 - x"
    using assms by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "y = 7"
    by (smt (verit) assms(2))
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma mathd_algebra_129_4:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
    and "- inverse a = 1/2"
  shows "- a = 2"
proof -

  then have "- 1 / a = 1 / 2" using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "- 1 = (1/2) * a" by (metis assms(1) inverse_eq_divide nonzero_divide_eq_eq right_inverse verit_minus_simplify(3) zero_neq_numeral)
  then have "-1 = a / 2" by auto
  then have "-2 = a" by auto
  then have "- a = 2" by simp
  thus ?thesis using assms by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_346:

  then have "-1 = (1/2) * a" by (metis assms(1) inverse_eq_divide inverse_unique nonzero_divide_eq_eq right_inverse verit_minus_simplify(3) zero_neq_numeral)
  then have "-1 = a / 2" by auto
  then have "-2 = a" by auto
  thus ?thesis using assms by auto
qed

theorem aime_1983_p9:
  fixes x::real
  assumes "0<x" "x<pi"
  shows "12 \<le> ((9 * (x^2 * (sin x)^2)) + 4) / (x * sin x)"
proof -

  have "12 \<le> (9 * y^2 + 4) / y"
  proof -

      by (simp add: assms(1) assms(2) sin_gt_zero y_def)
    have "(9 * y^2 + 4) \<ge> 12 * y"

  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: power_mult_distrib y_def)
qed

lemma substitute_and_solve:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x * (1 + y) = 5" "y + 1 / x = 29"
  shows "y = 24 \<and> x = 1 / 5"
proof -
  from assms(1) have "x + x * y = 5" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  from assms(2) have "y = 29 - 1 / x" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "x + x * (29 - 1 / x) = 5" using assms(1) by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "x + 29 * x - 1 = 5" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "30 * x = 6" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x = 1 / 5" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "y = 29 - 1 / (1 / 5)" by (metis \<open>y = 29 - 1 / x\<close>)
  then have "y = 29 - 5" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "y = 24" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>x = 1 / 5\<close>)
qed

  also have "... = (14)^2 - 2 * 19" using assms by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = 196 - 38" by (simp add: field_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "(a * b)=180"
    and "2 * (a + b)=54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  have "a + b = 54/2" using assms by simp
  then have "a + b = 27" by simp
  have "(a + b)^2 = 27^2" by (metis \<open>a + b = 27\<close>)
  also have "... = 729" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2" by (smt (verit) \<open>27\<^sup>2 = 729\<close> \<open>a + b = 27\<close> power2_sum)
  also have "... = a^2 + 2*180 + b^2" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = a^2 + 360 + b^2" by simp
  finally have "a^2 + 360 + b^2 = 729" by (metis \<open>27\<^sup>2 = 729\<close> \<open>729 = a\<^sup>2 + 2 * a * b + b\<^sup>2\<close> \<open>a + b = 27\<close> \<open>a\<^sup>2 + 2 * 180 + b\<^sup>2 = a\<^sup>2 + 360 + b\<^sup>2\<close> \<open>a\<^sup>2 + 2 * a * b + b\<^sup>2 = a\<^sup>2 + 2 * 180 + b\<^sup>2\<close> assms(1))
  have "a^2 + b^2 = 729 - 360" by (smt (verit) \<open>a\<^sup>2 + 360 + b\<^sup>2 = 729\<close>)
  then have "a^2 + b^2 = 369" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_141:
  fixes a b ::real
  assumes "(a * b) = 180"
    and "2 * (a + b) = 54"
  shows "a^2 + b^2 = 369"
proof -
  have c0: "a + b = 27" using assms(2) by auto
  have c1: "a * b = 180" using assms(1) by auto
  have c2: "a^2 + b^2 = (a + b)^2 - 2 * a * b" using algebra by (smt (verit) power2_sum)
  have c3: "(a + b)^2 = 729" using c0 by auto
  have c4: "a^2 + b^2 = 729 - 360" using c2 c1 c3 by auto
  then show ?thesis using c4 by auto
qed

  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = c * x^3 - 9 * x + 3"
    and  "f 2 = 9" 
  shows "c = 3"

  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

    using mod_mult_right_eq [of c a m] by simp

  "(\<Sum> k \<in> {x ::real. abs (2 - x) = 3}. k) = 4"
proof -
  have "{x ::real. abs (2 - x) = 3} = {5, -1}"
    by (auto simp add: abs_if)
  then have "(\<Sum> k \<in> {x ::real. abs (2 - x) = 3}. k) = 5 + (-1)"
    by (simp add: sum.insert)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_196:
  "(\<Sum> k \<in> {x ::real. abs (2 - x) = 3}. k) = 4"
proof -
  have "{x ::real. abs (2 - x) = 3} = {2 + 3, 2 - 3}"
    by (auto simp: abs_real_def)
  then have "(\<Sum> k \<in> {x ::real. abs (2 - x) = 3}. k) = (2 + 3) + (2 - 3)"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem aime_1983_p9:
  fixes x::real
  assumes "0<x" "x<pi"
  shows "12 \<le> ((9 * (x^2 * (sin x)^2)) + 4) / (x * sin x)"
proof -
  define y where "y=x * sin x"
  have "12 \<le> (9 * y^2 + 4) / y"
  proof -
    have c0: "y > 0"
      by (simp add: assms(1) assms(2) sin_gt_zero y_def)
    have "(9 * y^2 + 4) \<ge> 12 * y" 
      by sos
    then show ?thesis
      using c0 by (simp add: mult_imp_le_div_pos)
  qed
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: power_mult_distrib y_def)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  have "f (-3) = a * (-3)^4 - b * (-3)^2 + (-3) + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp
  then have "2 = a * 81 - b * 9 - 3 + 5"
    using assms(2) by simp
  then have "2 = a * 81 - b * 9 + 2"
    by simp
  then have "0 = a * 81 - b * 9"
    by simp
  then have "0 = 9 * (a * 9 - b)"
    by simp
  then have "0 = 9 * (a * 9 - b)"
    by simp
  then have "0 = a * 9 - b"
    by (simp add: zero_less_mult_iff zero_less_mult_iff)
  then have "b = a * 9"
    by simp
  then have "f 3 = a * 3^4 - b * 3^2 + 3 + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = a * 81 - (a * 9) * 9 + 3 + 5"
    by (smt (verit) Parity.ring_1_class.power_minus_even \<open>0 = a * 81 - b * 9\<close> \<open>2 = a * 81 - b * 9 + 2\<close> \<open>2 = a * 81 - b * 9 - 3 + 5\<close> \<open>b = a * 9\<close> \<open>f (- 3) = a * (- 3) ^ 4 - b * (- 3)\<^sup>2 + - 3 + 5\<close> add.left_commute add_cancel_right_right add_diff_add add_left_imp_eq assms(2) diff_diff_eq diff_minus_eq_add even_numeral is_num_normalize(8) minus_add_cancel minus_diff_eq minus_diff_minus minus_real_def odd_one power_minus_odd power_one_right)
  also have "... = a * 81 - a * 81 + 3 + 5"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = 8"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  have "f (-3) = a * (-3)^4 - b * (-3)^2 + (-3) + 5" using assms(1) by auto
  also have "... = 81*a - 9*b - 3 + 5" by simp
  finally have f_minus_3: "81*a - 9*b - 3 + 5 = 2" using assms(2) by auto
  have "f 3 = a * 3^4 - b * 3^2 + 3 + 5" using assms(1) by auto
  also have "... = 81*a - 9*b + 3 + 5" by simp
  also have "... = 81*a - 9*b + 8" by simp
  also have "... = 8" using f_minus_3 by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma square_root_non_negative:

lemma square_root_non_negative:

  then show ?thesis by simp

lemma function_composition:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = x + 1"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x^2 + 3"
  shows "f (g x) = (x^2 + 4)"
proof -
  have "f (g x) = (g x) + 1" using assms(1) by auto

qed

theorem mathd_algebra_304:
  "91^2 = (8281::nat)"
proof -
  let ?n = "91::nat"
  let ?a = "90::nat"
  let ?b = "1::nat"
  have "?n = ?a + ?b" by simp
  then have "?n^2 = (?a + ?b)^2" by auto
  also have "... = ?a^2 + 2*?a*?b + ?b^2" by simp
  also have "... = 8100 + 180 + 1" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 8281" by (simp)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma compute_n_squared:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(n^2) = ((n-1)^2 + 2 * (n-1) + 1)"
proof -
  have "(n^2) = (n-1 + 1)^2" by (metis add.commute add_diff_inverse_nat assms less_numeral_extra(3) less_one)
  also have "... = (n-1)^2 + 2 * (n-1) * 1 + 1^2" by (smt (verit) add.assoc add.commute one_power2 power2_sum)
  also have "... = (n-1)^2 + 2 * (n-1) + 1" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_304:
  "91^2 = (8281::nat)"
  using compute_n_squared [of 91] by simp

lemma compute_91_squared:
  "91^2 = (8281::nat)"
proof -
  have "(91::nat)^2 = (90 + 1)^2" by simp
  also have "... = 90^2 + 2 * 90 * 1 + 1^2" by auto
  also have "... = 8100 + 180 + 1" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 8281" by (simp)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_304:
  "91^2 = (8281::nat)"
  by (rule compute_91_squared)

theorem mathd_algebra_304:
  shows "91^2 = (8281::nat)"
proof -

  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

  then show ?thesis by simp

lemma assumption_simplification:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n = 11"
  shows "(1 / 4)^(n + 1) * 2^(2 * n) = (1 / 4)^(11 + 1) * 2^(2 * 11)"
proof -
  have "2^(2*n) = (4::real)^n" using exponent_simplification by blast
  then have "(1 / 4)^(n + 1) * 2^(2 * n) = (1 / 4)^(n + 1) * (4::real)^n"
    by simp
  then have "(1 / 4)^(n + 1) * (4::real)^n = (1 / 4)^(n + 1) * (4::real)^n"
    by simp
  then have "(1 / 4)^(n + 1) * (4::real)^n = (1 / 4)^(n + 1) * (4::real)^n"
    by auto
  then have "(1 / 4)^(n + 1) * (4::real)^n = (1 / 4)^(11 + 1) * (4::real)^11"
    using assms by auto
  then have "(1 / 4)^(11 + 1) * (4::real)^11 = (1 / 4)^(11 + 1) * (4::real)^11"
    by simp
  then have "(1 / 4)^(11 + 1) * (4::real)^11 = (1 / 4)^(11 + 1) * 2^(2 * 11)"
    using exponent_simplification by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis assms semiring_norm(5))
qed

lemma min_x_y:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "x = 3" "y = 7"
  shows "x + y = 10"
proof -
  from assms(1) have "x = 3" by auto
  from assms(2) have "y = 7" by auto
  then have "x + y = 3 + 7" by (metis assms(1))
  then show "x + y = 10" by auto
qed

lemma equation_simplification:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "3 * y = x"
    and "2 * x + 5 * y = 11"
  shows "x = 3" and "y = 1"
proof -
  have "(2 * x + 5 * y = 11) = (2 * (3 * y) + 5 * y = 11)" using assms(2) assms(1) by auto
  then have "(2 * x + 5 * y = 11) = (6 * y + 5 * y = 11)" by auto
  then have "(2 * x + 5 * y = 11) = (11 * y = 11)" by auto
  then have "(2 * x + 5 * y = 11) = (y = 1)" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then show "y = 1" using assms(2) by (simp add: field_simps)
  then show "x = 3" using assms(1) by auto
qed

lemma find_x_y_value:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes 
    "3 * y = x"
    "2 * x + 5 * y = 11"
  shows "x = 3 \<and> y = 1"
proof -
  from assms(2) have "2 * x + 5 * y = 11" by auto
  from assms(1) have "3 * y = x" by auto
  then have "x = 3 * y" by auto
  then have "2 * (3 * y) + 5 * y = 11" using \<open>2 * x + 5 * y = 11\<close> by (metis mult.commute)
  then have "6 * y + 5 * y = 11" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "11 * y = 11" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "y = 1" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "x = 3 * y" using assms(1) by (simp add: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis using \<open>y = 1\<close> by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

lemma modulo_4_residue:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "a mod 4 = 1" "b mod 4 = 2" "c mod 4 = 3"
  shows "(a * b * c) mod 4 = 2"
proof -
  have "a mod 4 = 1" and "b mod 4 = 2" and "c mod 4 = 3" using assms by simp_all
  then have "(a * b * c) mod 4 = ((1 * 2 * 3) mod 4)"
    by (metis mod_mult_eq mod_mult_left_eq mult.commute mult.left_commute nat_mult_1 num_double numeral_times_numeral semiring_norm(3))
  also have "... = (6 mod 4)"
    by (simp add: mod_mult_right_eq)
  also have "... = 2"
    by auto
  finally show "(a * b * c) mod 4 = 2".
qed

lemma modulo_4_residue:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  assumes "a mod 4 = 1" "b mod 4 = 2" "c mod 4 = 3"
  shows "(a * b * c) mod 4 = 2"
proof -
  have "(a * b * c) mod 4 = ((a mod 4) * (b mod 4) * (c mod 4)) mod 4"
    by (smt (verit) mod_mod_trivial mod_mult_cong mod_mult_eq)
  also have "... = (1 * 2 * 3) mod 4"
    using assms by simp
  also have "... = 6 mod 4"
    by simp
  also have "... = 2"
    by auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5" and "a + b = 2"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  have "a + b = 2" by fact
  have "3 * a + 2 * b = 5" by fact
  then have "3 * a + 2 * (2 - a) = 5" using \<open>a + b = 2\<close> by simp
  then have "3 * a + 4 - 2 * a = 5" by simp
  then have "a + 4 = 5" by simp
  then have "a = 1" by simp
  then have "b = 1" using \<open>a + b = 2\<close> by simp
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>a = 1\<close>)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_346:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -

  then have "f 5 - 1 = 10 - 4" by simp
  then have "f 5 - 1 = 6" by simp
  then have "g (f 5 - 1) = g 6" by simp
  also have "... = 6 + 1" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 7" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma f_5:

theorem function_composition_theorem:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = x + 1"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x^2 + 3" 
  shows "f (g 2) = f (7)"
proof -
  have "g 2 = 2^2 + 3" using assms(2) by auto
  also have "... = 7" by simp
  finally have g2: "g 2 = 7" by auto
  have "f (g 2) = (g 2) + 1" using assms(1) g2 by auto
  also have "... = f 7" using assms(1) by (metis add.commute assms(2) g2 one_plus_numeral_commute)
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma function_evaluation_at_x_equals_5_minus_1:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "f 5 - 1 = 2 * 5 - 3 - 1"
proof -
  have "f 5 = 2 * 5 - 3" 
    using assms(1) by auto
  also have "... = 10 - 3" 
    by auto
  also have "... = 7" 
    by auto
  also have "... - 1 = 6" 
    by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis assms(1))
qed

lemma mathd_algebra_346:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x - 3"
    and "\<forall> x. g x = x + 1"
  shows "g (f 5 - 1) = 7"
proof -
  have "f 5 - 1 = 6" 
    using function_evaluation_at_x_equals_5_minus_1 by (smt (verit) assms(1))
  then have "g (f 5 - 1) = g 6" 
    by (metis function_evaluation_at_x_equals_5_minus_1)
  also have "... = 6 + 1" 
    using assms(2) by auto
  also have "... = 7" 
    by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

  then have "a + 20 * d = 60 + 10 * 15/2" using assms(1) assms(2) by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp

lemma arithmetic_sequence_difference:
  fixes a d :: real
  shows "(a + n * d) - (a + m * d) = (n - m) * d"
proof -
  have "(a + n * d) - (a + m * d) = (a + n * d) - a - (a + m * d) + a" by auto
  also have "... = (n * d - m * d)" by auto
  also have "... = (n - m) * d" by sos
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma arithmetic_sequence:
  fixes a :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> n. a (n + 1) - a n = a (n + 2) - a (n + 1)"
  shows "a (n + 1) = a n + (a (n + 2) - a (n + 1))"
proof -
  from assms have "a (n + 1) - a n = a (n + 2) - a (n + 1)" by simp
  then have "a (n + 1) = a n + (a (n + 2) - a (n + 1))" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma arithmetic_sequence_difference:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "a (n + 1) - a n = a (n + 2) - a (n + 1)"
  shows "a (n + 1) - a n = a (n + 2) - a (n + 1)"
  by (simp add: assms)

lemma find_common_difference:
  fixes a d :: real
  assumes "a + 6 * d = 30"
    and "a + 10 * d = 60" 
  shows "d = 15/2"
proof -
  from assms(2) have "a + 10 * d = 60" .
  then have "a + 6 * d + 4 * d = 60" using assms(1) by auto
  then have "30 + 4 * d = 60" by (metis assms(1))
  then have "4 * d = 30" by auto
  then have "d = 30 / 4" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "d = 15/2" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma powr_realpow:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "(a powr b) powr c = a powr (b * c)"
proof -
  have "a powr (b * c) = (a powr b) powr c"
    by (metis powr_powr)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma antilogarithm_identity:
  assumes "a > 0" and "a \<noteq> 1" and "b > 0" and "log a b = c"
  shows "b = a ^ c"
proof -
  from assms(4) have "log a b = c" .
  then have "b = a powr c" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) powr_log_cancel)
  also have "... = a ^ c" by (smt (verit) Transcendental.powr_realpow assms(1))
  finally show "b = a ^ c" .
qed

lemma solve_for_a_and_b:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "c > 0"
  assumes "c*a + b = d"
  shows "b = d - c*a"
proof -

    using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma solve_for_a_and_b2:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "c > 0"
  assumes "c*a + b = d"
  shows "a = (d-b) div c"
proof -
  have "c*a = d - b"
    using assms by simp
  then have "a = (d-b) div c"
    using `c > 0`
    by (smt (verit) div_mult_self1_is_m)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma find_a_b_value:
  fixes c d :: real
  assumes 
    "c/3 + d/1 = 5"
    "d/3 + c/1 = 7"
  shows "c = 6 \<and> d = 3"
proof -
  from assms have c0: "c + 3 * d = 15" by auto
  from assms have c1: "3 * c + d = 21" by auto
  have c2: "8 * c = 48" using c0 by (smt (verit) c1)
  hence c3: "c = 6" using c2 by auto
  hence "d = 3" using c1 by auto
  then show ?thesis using c3 by auto
qed

lemma equation_substitution:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a^2 * b^3 = 32 / 27" and "b^3 = a * (4/27)"
  shows "a^3 = 8"
proof -
  have "a^2 * (a * (4/27)) = 32 / 27"
    using assms(1) by (metis assms(2))
  hence "a^3 * (4/27) = 32 / 27"
    by sos
  hence "a^3 = 8"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma rearrange_second_equation:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a / b^3 = 27 / 4"
  shows "b^3 = a * (4/27)"
proof -
  have "b^3 = a / (a / b^3)"
    using assms by auto
  also have "... = a / (27/4)"
    using assms by presburger
  also have "... = a * 4 / 27"
    by auto
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma manipulate_equations:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a / b^3 = 27 / 4"
  shows "b^3 = 4 / 27 * a"
proof -
  from rearrange_second_equation[OF assms] 
  show ?thesis by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

lemma manipulate_equations:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a / b^3 = 27 / 4"
  shows "b^3 = 4 / 27 * a"
proof -
  have "b^3 = a / (a / b^3)"
    using assms by auto
  also have "... = a / (27/4)"
    using assms by presburger
  also have "... = a * 4 / 27"
    by auto
  also have "... = 4 / 27 * a"
    by (simp add: mult.commute)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma real_sum:

  assumes "a = 2" and "b = 2 / 3"
  shows "a + b = 8 / 3"
proof -

    using assms by auto

    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a + b = 8 / 3"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes x y z w :: real
  assumes "w = y - 3*z"
  shows "3*x + 4*w = 3*x + 4*(y - 3*z)"
proof -
  have "w = y - 3*z" using assms by assumption
  then have "4*w = 4*(y - 3*z)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)

lemma solve_equation:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "9 * x + 12 * w - 8 * x - 12 * w = 30 - 16"
  shows "x = 14"
proof -
  have "9 * x + 12 * w - 8 * x - 12 * w = 14" using assms by simp
  have "... = 14" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  hence "x = 14" by (metis \<open>9 * x + 12 * w - 8 * x - 12 * w = 14\<close> add.commute add_diff_cancel_left' dbl_def dbl_inc_def dbl_inc_simps(3) dbl_inc_simps(5) dbl_simps(3) dbl_simps(5) diff_conv_add_uminus diff_diff_eq2 inc.simps(1) minus_diff_eq mult.commute mult_minus1_right right_diff_distrib verit_minus_simplify(4))
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma solve_equation:
  fixes x :: real
  fixes w :: real
  assumes "9 * x + 12 * w - 8 * x - 12 * w = 30 - 16"
  shows "x = 14"
proof -
  have "9 * x - 8 * x + 12 * w - 12 * w = 30 - 16" by (metis assms group_cancel.add1 uminus_add_conv_diff)
  then have "x + 0 = 14" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_398:
  fixes a b c ::real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and "9 * b = 20 * c"
    and "7 * a = 4 * b"
  shows "63 * a = 80 * c"
proof -  
  have "7 * a = 4 * b" and "9 * b = 20 * c" using assms by auto
  then have "63 * a = 4 * (9 * b)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 4 * (20 * c)" using assms by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 80 * c" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma helper:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b \<and> 0 < c"
    and "9 * b = 20 * c"
    and "7 * a = 4 * b"
  shows "63 * a = 80 * c"
proof -
  from assms(2) have "9 * b = 20 * c" by simp
  from assms(3) have "7 * a = 4 * b" by simp
  then have "b = (7/4) * a" by (simp add: field_simps)
  from this and assms(2) have "9 * ((7/4) * a) = 20 * c" by (simp add: field_simps)
  hence "(63/4) * a = 20 * c" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "63 * a = 80 * c" by (simp add: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem solve_for_b:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0 : "3*a+2*b=12"
  shows "b=(12-3*a)/2"
proof -

    using h0 by simp
  then have "b = (12-3*a)/2"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "3 * a + 2 * b = 5" and "a + b = 2"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 1"
proof -
  have "a + b = 2" by fact
  have "3 * a + 2 * b = 5" by fact
  then have "3 * a + 2 * (2 - a) = 5" using \<open>a + b = 2\<close> by simp
  then have "3 * a + 4 - 2 * a = 5" by simp
  then have "a + 4 = 5" by simp
  then have "a = 1" by simp
  then have "b = 1" using \<open>a + b = 2\<close> by simp
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>a = 1\<close>)
qed

lemma am_gm:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x >= 0" "y >= 0"
  shows "x^2 + y^2 >= 2*x*y"
proof -
  have "(x - y)^2 >= 0" by auto
  also have "(x - y)^2 = x^2 - 2*x*y + y^2" by sos
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma am_gm:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x >= 0" "y >= 0"
  shows "x^2 + y^2 >= 2*x*y"
  using assms by (simp add: sum_squares_bound)

lemma am_gm_divide_form:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x > 0" "y > 0"
  shows "x/y + y/x >= 2"
proof -
  have c0:"sqrt(x/y) \<ge> 0"
    using assms by simp
  have c1:"sqrt(y/x) \<ge> 0"
    using assms by simp
  have "x/y + y/x >= 2 * sqrt(x/y) * sqrt(y/x)"
    using am_gm[of "sqrt(x/y)" "sqrt(y/x)"] c0 c1 by simp
   have "2 * sqrt(x/y) * sqrt(y/x) = 2 * sqrt(x/y * y/x)"
    by (metis ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) real_sqrt_mult times_divide_eq_right)
  then have "... = 2"
    using assms(1) assms(2) by fastforce
  show ?thesis
    using \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y * y / x) = 2\<close> \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y) * sqrt (y / x) = 2 * sqrt (x / y * y / x)\<close> \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y) * sqrt (y / x) \<le> x / y + y / x\<close> by presburger
qed

theorem amc12a_2013_p7:
  fixes s :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>n. n\<ge>2 \<Longrightarrow> s (n+2) = s (n+1) + s n"
    and h1 : "s 9 = 110"
    and h2 : "s 7 = 42"
  shows "s 4 = 10"
proof -
  have "s 8 = 68" using h1 h2 h0[of 7] by auto
  hence h3: "s 6 = 26" using h2 h0[of 6] by auto
  hence "s 5 = 16" using h2 h0[of 5] by auto
  then show ?thesis using h3 h0[of 4] by auto
qed

theorem fib_sequence:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n\<ge>2"
  shows "fib (n+2) = fib (n+1) + fib n"
proof -
  have "fib (Suc (Suc n)) = fib (Suc n) + fib n" for n::nat
    by (induction n) (simp_all)
  then show ?thesis using assms
    by (metis Suc_eq_plus1 add_Suc_right numeral_2_eq_2 numeral_3_eq_3 numeral_One one_add_one)
qed

lemma helper_func:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" 
  shows "12 / (x * x) * (x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)) = 10"
proof -
  have "12 / (x * x) * (x^4 / (14 * x)) * (35 / (3 * x)) = (12 * x^3 * 35) / (x^2 * x * 14 * 3)"
    by sos

  fixes a b :: real
  shows "(a powr b) powr c = a powr (b * c)"
proof -

lemma antilogarithm_identity:
  assumes "a > 0" and "a \<noteq> 1" and "b > 0" and "log a b = c"
  shows "b = a ^ c"
proof -
  from assms(4) have "log a b = c" .
  then have "b = a powr c" by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) powr_log_cancel)
  also have "... = a ^ c" by (smt (verit) Transcendental.powr_realpow assms(1))
  finally show "b = a ^ c" .
qed

proof -

  from assms have c1: "3 * c + d = 21" by auto
  have c2: "8 * c = 48" using c0 by (smt (verit) c1)
  hence c3: "c = 6" using c2 by auto
  hence "d = 3" using c1 by auto
  then show ?thesis using c3 by auto
qed

data/full_data/test/mathd_numbertheory_1:
lemma gcd_lcm:
  fixes a :: nat
  assumes "a > 0"
  shows "lcm a b * gcd a b = a * b"
  by (simp add: assms)

theorem mathd_numbertheory_222:
  fixes b :: nat
  assumes "lcm 120 b = 3720"
    and "gcd 120 b = 8" 
  shows "b = 248"
proof -
  have "(lcm 120 b) * (gcd 120 b) = 120 * b"
    using gcd_lcm assms(2)
    by (metis gcd.commute lcm.commute mult.commute prod_gcd_lcm_nat)
  then have "3720 * 8 = 120 * b"
    using assms(1)
    by (metis assms(2))
  then have "b = 3720 * 8 / 120"
    by (simp only: divide_cancel_left)
  also have "... = 248"
    by (simp add: ac_simps)
  finally show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

lemma sixth_power_of_n:

  shows "n^6 = n * n * n * n * n * n"
proof -
  show ?thesis by (metis eval_nat_numeral(2) eval_nat_numeral(3) mult.commute power4_eq_xxxx power_Suc power_Suc2 semiring_norm(28))
qed

lemma mod_multiply_complicated:
  fixes a b c m :: nat
  assumes "a mod m = b"
  shows "(c * a) mod m = (c * b) mod m"
proof -
  have "c * (a mod m) = c * b"
    using assms by (simp add: mod_mult_right_eq)
  then have "(c * (a mod m)) mod m = (c * b) mod m"
    by (metis mod_mult_left_eq mod_mod_cancel)
  thus ?thesis by (simp add: mod_mult_right_eq)
qed

lemma multiples_of_20:
  fixes x :: nat
  assumes "20 dvd x" "15 \<le> x" "x < 86"
  shows "x \<in> {20, 40, 60, 80}"
proof -
  from assms(1) have "x mod 20 = 0" by auto
  then have "x div 20 = x div 20" by simp
  then have "x = 20 * (x div 20)" by (metis assms(1) dvd_mult_div_cancel)
  with assms have "x = 20 * (x div 20)" by (simp add: mult_le_mono)
  then show "x \<in> {20, 40, 60, 80}" using assms by auto
qed

theorem numbertheory_ndvdnexpn:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(2::nat) dvd 4^n"
proof -
  obtain m::nat where c0: "m+1=n"
    by (metis add.commute h0 less_imp_add_positive less_one nat_neq_iff plus_nat.add_0)
  have "(2::nat) dvd 4^(m+1)" by auto
  then show ?thesis unfolding c0 by auto
qed

theorem numbertheory_ndvdnexpn_2d:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(2::nat) dvd 4^n" (is "?thesis1")
and "(2::nat) dvd 4^n" (is "?thesis2")
proof -
  obtain m::nat where c0: "m+1=n"
    by (metis add.commute h0 less_imp_add_positive less_one nat_neq_iff plus_nat.add_0)
  have "(2::nat) dvd 4^(m+1)" by auto
  then show "?thesis1" unfolding c0 by auto
  show "?thesis2" unfolding c0 by (metis \<open>even (4 ^ n)\<close>)
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_185:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n mod 5 = 3"
  shows "(2 * n) mod 5 = 1"
proof -

    by (metis assms mod_mult_right_eq)
  also have "... = (2 * 3) mod 5"
    by (simp add: assms)
  also have "... = 6 mod 5"
    by presburger
  also have "... = 1"
    by presburger
  finally show ?thesis by simp

lemma mod_mult:

proof -

    by (metis mod_mult_left_eq)
  also have "(a mod c) * b mod c = ((a mod c) * (b mod c)) mod c" 
    by (metis mod_mult_right_eq)
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma helper:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "n mod 7 = 5"
  shows "(5 * n) mod 7 = 25 mod 7"
proof -

  then have "(5 * n) mod 7 = 25 mod 7" by presburger
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_335:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "n mod 7 = 5"
  shows "(5 * n) mod 7 = 4"
proof -
  have "(5 * n) mod 7 = 25 mod 7" using helper[of n] assms by simp
  then have "\<dots> = 4" by (simp add: mod_mod_trivial)
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>5 * n mod 7 = 25 mod 7\<close> mult.commute nat_mod_eq_iff)
qed

lemma recursive_seq_backward_calculation:
  fixes s :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<And>n. s (n + 2) = s (n + 1) + s n"
  shows "s (n + 1) = s (n + 2) - s n"
proof -

lemma quadratic_formula:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a\<noteq>0" "a\<noteq>1" "a\<noteq>-1"
  shows "(- b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a) = (- b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)"
proof -

    using assms by (smt (verit) add_diff_eq add_less_cancel_left diff_less_eq less_add_same_cancel2 real_sqrt_gt_0_iff)
  then have "(- b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a) = (- b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)"
    by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

  from assms(2) have "y = 29 - 1 / x" by (simp add: field_simps)

  then have "y = 29 - 1 / (1 / 5)" by (metis \<open>y = 29 - 1 / x\<close>)
  then have "y = 29 - 5" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "y = 24" by (simp add: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by (metis \<open>x = 1 / 5\<close>)
qed

  fixes a b c d :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d"
proof -
  have "(a + b) * (c + d) = (a + b) * c + (a + b) * d" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  also have "... = (a * c + b * c) + (a * d + b * d)" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma modular_arithmetic:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "x mod 19 = 4" "y mod 19 = 7"
  shows "(x+1)^2 mod 19 = 5^2 mod 19" "(y+5)^3 mod 19 = 12^3 mod 19"
proof -
  have c0: "(x+1)^2 mod 19 = 5^2 mod 19"
    using mod_exp_add_1[where x="x" and n=19 and a=4 and c=2] assms(1) by simp
  have c1: "(y+5)^3 mod 19 = 12^3 mod 19"
    using mod_exp_add_5[where x="y" and n=19 and a=7 and c=3] assms(2) by simp
  then show "(x+1)^2 mod 19 = 5^2 mod 19" and "(y+5)^3 mod 19 = 12^3 mod 19"
    using c0 c1 by auto
qed

lemma step_4:
  fixes x y :: nat
  assumes "x mod 19 = 4" "y mod 19 = 7"
  shows "(x + 1)^2 * (y + 5)^3 mod 19 = 13"
proof -
  have c0: "(x+1)^2 mod 19 = 5^2 mod 19"
    using modular_arithmetic assms by auto
  have c1: "(y+5)^3 mod 19 = 12^3 mod 19"
    using modular_arithmetic assms by auto
  have "(x + 1)^2 * (y + 5)^3 mod 19 = ((x+1)^2 mod 19) * ((y+5)^3 mod 19) mod 19"
    by (metis mod_mult_eq)
  also have "... = (5^2 mod 19) * (12^3 mod 19) mod 19"
    unfolding c0 c1 by auto
  also have "... = 6 * 18 mod 19"
    by auto
  also have "... = 13"
    by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

Here is the formal proof in Isabelle:
```isabelle
theory aime_1983_p2
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem aime_1983_p2:
  fixes x p ::real and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0: "0 < p \<and> p < 15"
      and h1: "p \<le> x \<and> x \<le> 15"
      and h2: "f x = abs (x - p) + abs (x - 15) + abs (x - p - 15)" 
    shows "15 \<le> f x"

proof -
  from h0 have p_neq_15: "p\<noteq>15" by simp
  from h1 have x_le_15: "x\<le>15" by simp
  from h1 have p_le_x: "p\<le>x" by simp
  from h1 have x_ge_p: "x\<ge>p" by simp

  have c1: "f x = 30 - x"
  proof -
    from h2 have "f x = abs (x - p) + abs (x - 15) + abs (x - p - 15)"
      using h2 by simp
    also have "... = abs (x - p) + (15 - x) + (15 + p - x)"
      using x_le_15 x_ge_p p_neq_15 by (simp add: abs_minus_commute)
    also have "... = x - p + 15 - x + 15 + p - x"
      using x_ge_p p_le_x by (simp add: abs_minus_commute)
    also have "... = 30 - x"
      using x_ge_p p_le_x by (simp add: abs_minus_commute)
    finally show ?thesis by simp
  qed

  from c1 have "f x = 30 - x"
    by simp

  from h1 have "x\<le>15" by simp
  then have "30 - x \<ge> 30 - 15"
    using h1 by (simp add: diff_ge_zero)
  then have "30 - x \<ge> 15"
    using h1 by (simp add: diff_ge_zero)
  then show ?thesis
    using c1 by simp
qed
```

Note that the proof is divided into several steps, each of which is justified by a separate lemma. The final step shows that $f(x) \geq 15$, as required.

task_to_proof.data/full_data/test/algebra_sqineq_at2ma:
## Problems
Show that for any real number $a$, $a(2-a)\leq 1$.

## Informal proof
### Problem 1
Step 1: Recognize that $(a - 1)^2 \geq 0$ for any real number $a$.
Step 2: Expand the inequality $(a - 1)^2 \geq 0$ to get $a^2 - 2a + 1 \geq 0$.
Step 3: Rearrange the inequality $a^2 - 2a + 1 \geq 0$ to get $a(2-a) \leq 1$.
Step 4: Conclude that $a(2-a) \leq 1$ for any real number $a$.

## Formal statement
```isabelle
theory algebra_sqineq_at2malt1
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem algebra_sqineq_at2malt1:
  fixes a::real 
  shows "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1"
proof -
  
  have c0: "(a - 1)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  
  then have "a^2 - 2 * a + 1 \<ge> 0" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  
  then have "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1" by (simp add: le_diff_conv2)
  
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
  assumes h0: "a^2 + b^2 = 1"
  shows "a * b + (a - b) \<le> 1"
proof -
  
  have c0: "(a - b - 1)^2 >= 0" using assms
    sledgehammer

  
  have c1: "(a - b - 1)^2 = a^2 - a * b - a - a * b + b^2 + b - a + b + 1"
    using c0
    sledgehammer

  
  have c2: "a^2 - a * b - a - a * b + b^2 + b - a + b + 1 = (a^2 + b^2) - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1"
    using c1 assms
    sledgehammer
  also have "... = 1 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1"
    using assms
    sledgehammer
  also have "... = 2 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b"
    sledgehammer
  ultimately have c3: "2 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b >= 0"
    sledgehammer

  
  have "(a - b - 1)^2 >= 0" using c0
    sledgehammer
  then have "a^2 - 2 * a * b + b^2 - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1 >= 0"
    sledgehammer
  then have "a^2 + b^2 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1 >= 0"
    using c1
    sledgehammer
  then have "1 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b + 1 >= 0"
    using assms
    sledgehammer
  then have "2 - 2 * a * b - 2 * a + 2 * b >= 0"
    sledgehammer
  then have "2 * (1 - a * b - a + b) >= 0"
    sledgehammer
  then have "1 - a * b - a + b >= 0"
    sledgehammer
  then have "a * b + (a - b) <= 1"
    sledgehammer
  then show ?thesis
    sledgehammer
qed

end
```

```isabelle
lemma distributive_property:
  fixes a b c :: "int"
  shows "(a * (b + c)) = (a * b) + (a * c)"
  by (simp add: algebra_simps)

lemma substitution:
  fixes x :: "int"
  assumes "x = 4"
  shows "3 * x - 1 = 11"
proof -
```
